	<h1 id="firstHeading" class="firstHeading" >Luis Suárez</h1>
	<div id="bodyContent" class="mw-body-content">
		<div id="siteSub" class="noprint">From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia</div>
		<div id="contentSub"><span class="mw-redirectedfrom">&#160;&#160;(Redirected from <a href="/w/index.php?title=Luis_Suarez&amp;redirect=no" class="mw-redirect" title="Luis Suarez">Luis Suarez</a>)</span></div>
		<div id="contentSub2"></div>
		
		<div id="jump-to-nav"></div>
		<a class="mw-jump-link" href="#mw-head">Jump to navigation</a>
		<a class="mw-jump-link" href="#searchInput">Jump to search</a>
		<div id="mw-content-text" lang="en" dir="ltr" class="mw-content-ltr"><div class="mw-parser-output"><div class="shortdescription nomobile noexcerpt noprint searchaux" style="display:none">Uruguayan footballer</div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">For the Spanish footballer, see <a href="/wiki/Luis_Su%C3%A1rez_(footballer,_born_1935)" title="Luis Suárez (footballer, born 1935)">Luis Suárez (footballer, born 1935)</a>. For other people named Luis Suárez, see <a href="/wiki/Luis_Su%C3%A1rez_(disambiguation)" class="mw-disambig" title="Luis Suárez (disambiguation)">Luis Suárez (disambiguation)</a>.</div>
<p class="mw-empty-elt">

</p>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">In this <a href="/wiki/Spanish_name" class="mw-redirect" title="Spanish name">Spanish name</a>, the first or paternal&#32;<a href="/wiki/Surname" title="Surname">surname</a> is <i> Suárez</i>&#32;and the second or maternal family name is <i> Díaz</i>.</div>

<td style="text-align:center;vertical-align:middle;">

* Senior club appearances and goals counted for the domestic league only&#32;and correct as of 13 March 2021<br /> National team caps and goals correct as of 13 November 2020</td></tr></tbody></table>
<p><b>Luis Alberto Suárez Díaz</b> (<small>American Spanish:&#160;</small><span title="Representation in the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA)" class="IPA"><a href="/wiki/Help:IPA/Spanish" title="Help:IPA/Spanish">[lwis swaes]</a></span>; born 24 January 1987) is a Uruguayan professional <a href="/wiki/Association_football" title="Association football">footballer</a> who plays as a <a href="/wiki/Forward_(association_football)#Striker" title="Forward (association football)">striker</a> for Spanish club <a href="/wiki/Atl%C3%A9tico_Madrid" title="Atlético Madrid">Atlético Madrid</a><sup id="cite_ref-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2">&#91;2&#93;</a></sup> and the <a href="/wiki/Uruguay_national_football_team" title="Uruguay national football team">Uruguay national team</a>. Regarded as one of the best players of his generation and one of the greatest strikers of all time,<sup id="cite_ref-10" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-10">&#91;note 1&#93;</a></sup> Suárez has won 19 trophies in his career, including six league titles and a <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Champions_League" title="UEFA Champions League">UEFA Champions League</a> title at club level, and a <a href="/wiki/Copa_Am%C3%A9rica" title="Copa América">Copa América</a> with Uruguay. A prolific goalscorer, Suárez has won two <a href="/wiki/European_Golden_Shoe" title="European Golden Shoe">European Golden Shoes</a>, an <a href="/wiki/Eredivisie#Top_scorers" title="Eredivisie">Eredivisie Golden Boot</a>, a <a href="/wiki/Premier_League_Golden_Boot" title="Premier League Golden Boot">Premier League Golden Boot</a>, and the <a href="/wiki/Pichichi_Trophy" title="Pichichi Trophy">Pichichi Trophy</a>. He has scored <a href="/wiki/List_of_men%27s_footballers_with_500_or_more_goals" class="mw-redirect" title="List of men&#39;s footballers with 500 or more goals">over 500 career goals</a> for club and country.<sup id="cite_ref-300_goals_11-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-300_goals-11">&#91;10&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-12" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-12">&#91;11&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Nicknamed <b>El Pistolero</b> ('The Gunman'),<sup id="cite_ref-13" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-13">&#91;12&#93;</a></sup> Suárez began his senior club career at <a href="/wiki/Club_Nacional_de_Football" title="Club Nacional de Football">Nacional</a> in 2005. At age 19, he signed for <a href="/wiki/FC_Groningen" title="FC Groningen">Groningen</a>, before transferring to <a href="/wiki/AFC_Ajax" title="AFC Ajax">Ajax</a> in 2007. There, he won an <a href="/wiki/Eredivisie" title="Eredivisie">Eredivisie</a> title and <a href="/wiki/2009%E2%80%9310_KNVB_Cup" title="200910 KNVB Cup">KNVB Cup</a>. In 2011, Suárez signed for <a href="/wiki/Premier_League" title="Premier League">Premier League</a> club <a href="/wiki/Liverpool_F.C." title="Liverpool F.C.">Liverpool</a>, and won the <a href="/wiki/2011%E2%80%9312_Football_League_Cup" title="201112 Football League Cup">League Cup</a> in his first full season. In 2014, he equalled the goalscoring record for a 38-game Premier League season and won his first <a href="/wiki/European_Golden_Shoe" title="European Golden Shoe">European Golden Shoe</a>. That summer, Suárez moved to <a href="/wiki/FC_Barcelona" title="FC Barcelona">Barcelona</a> in a transfer worth 82.3&#160;million (£64.98&#160;million), making him <a href="/wiki/List_of_most_expensive_association_football_transfers" title="List of most expensive association football transfers">one of the most expensive players</a> in football history.<sup id="cite_ref-Revealed:_How_much_Luis_Suarez_really_cost_Barcelona_14-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Revealed:_How_much_Luis_Suarez_really_cost_Barcelona-14">&#91;13&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-:1_15-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-:1-15">&#91;14&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>In his first season, he won a <a href="/wiki/Treble_(association_football)" title="Treble (association football)">continental treble</a> of <a href="/wiki/La_Liga" title="La Liga">La Liga</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Copa_del_Rey" title="Copa del Rey">Copa del Rey</a> and the UEFA Champions League with Barcelona. In his second season, Suárez won the <a href="/wiki/Pichichi_Trophy" title="Pichichi Trophy">Pichichi Trophy</a> and his second European Golden Shoe, becoming the first player since 2009 to win both awards other than Messi or <a href="/wiki/Cristiano_Ronaldo" title="Cristiano Ronaldo">Cristiano Ronaldo</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-16" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-16">&#91;15&#93;</a></sup> He also led La Liga in assists, becoming the first player to do so in both goals and assists in league history.<sup id="cite_ref-Goal.com_17-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Goal.com-17">&#91;16&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Luis_Suarez_Player_Profile_18-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Luis_Suarez_Player_Profile-18">&#91;17&#93;</a></sup> With Barcelona, he won 10 additional trophies, including three La Liga titles and three <a href="/wiki/Copa_del_Rey" title="Copa del Rey">Copas del Rey</a>. He signed for Atlético Madrid in 2020.
</p><p>At international level, Suárez is Uruguay's <a href="/wiki/Uruguay_national_football_team#Records" title="Uruguay national football team">all-time leading goalscorer</a>, and has represented his nation at three editions of the <a href="/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup" title="FIFA World Cup">FIFA World Cup</a> and <a href="/wiki/Copa_Am%C3%A9rica" title="Copa América">Copa América</a>, as well as the <a href="/wiki/Football_at_the_2012_Summer_Olympics_%E2%80%93_Men%27s_tournament" title="Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics  Men&#39;s tournament">2012 Summer Olympics</a> and the <a href="/wiki/2013_FIFA_Confederations_Cup" title="2013 FIFA Confederations Cup">2013 FIFA Confederations Cup</a>.
</p><p>Suárez has been a source of controversy throughout his career.<sup id="cite_ref-22" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-22">&#91;note 2&#93;</a></sup> As well as his goal-line handball, he has also bitten opponents on three occasions.<sup id="cite_ref-27" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-27">&#91;note 3&#93;</a></sup> Suárez has also been accused of and admitted to <a href="/wiki/Diving_(association_football)" title="Diving (association football)">diving</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-doeshedive_28-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-doeshedive-28">&#91;25&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-admitdiving_29-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-admitdiving-29">&#91;26&#93;</a></sup> and in 2011, the <a href="/wiki/The_Football_Association" title="The Football Association">FA</a> found him guilty of racially abusing <a href="/wiki/Patrice_Evra" title="Patrice Evra">Patrice Evra</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-racialguilt_30-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-racialguilt-30">&#91;27&#93;</a></sup> a decision Suárez disputes.<sup id="cite_ref-Suarez_statement_31-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Suarez_statement-31">&#91;28&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div id="toc" class="toc" role="navigation" aria-labelledby="mw-toc-heading"><input type="checkbox" role="button" id="toctogglecheckbox" class="toctogglecheckbox" style="display:none" /><div class="toctitle" lang="en" dir="ltr"><h2 id="mw-toc-heading">Contents</h2><span class="toctogglespan"><label class="toctogglelabel" for="toctogglecheckbox"></label></span></div>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Club_career">Club career</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Luis_Su%C3%A1rez&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1" title="Edit section: Club career">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Youth">Youth</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Luis_Su%C3%A1rez&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" title="Edit section: Youth">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<div class="quotebox pullquote floatright" style="width:25%; ;"><style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1012376600">.mw-parser-output .quotebox{background-color:#F9F9F9;border:1px solid #aaa;box-sizing:border-box;padding:10px;font-size:88%;max-width:100%}.mw-parser-output .quotebox.floatleft{margin:0.5em 1.4em 0.8em 0}.mw-parser-output .quotebox.floatright{margin:0.5em 0 0.8em 1.4em}.mw-parser-output .quotebox.centered{margin:0.5em auto 0.8em auto}.mw-parser-output .quotebox.floatleft p,.mw-parser-output .quotebox.floatright p{font-style:inherit}.mw-parser-output .quotebox-title{background-color:#F9F9F9;text-align:center;font-size:larger;font-weight:bold}.mw-parser-output .quotebox-quote.quoted:before{font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-weight:bold;font-size:large;color:gray;content:"  ";vertical-align:-45%;line-height:0}.mw-parser-output .quotebox-quote.quoted:after{font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-weight:bold;font-size:large;color:gray;content:"  ";line-height:0}.mw-parser-output .quotebox .left-aligned{text-align:left}.mw-parser-output .quotebox .right-aligned{text-align:right}.mw-parser-output .quotebox .center-aligned{text-align:center}.mw-parser-output .quotebox cite{display:block;font-style:normal}@media screen and (max-width:640px){.mw-parser-output .quotebox{width:100%!important;margin:0 0 0.8em!important;float:none!important}}</style>
<div class="quotebox-quote left-aligned" style="">"As I was growing up, there was only one player I looked up to, and that was Batistuta, the Argentina No.9."</div>
<p><cite class="left-aligned" style="">Suárez on his childhood idol, <a href="/wiki/Gabriel_Batistuta" title="Gabriel Batistuta">Gabriel Batistuta</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-32" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-32">&#91;29&#93;</a></sup></cite>
</p>
</div>
<p>Suárez lived his early years at the Cerro neighbourhood in <a href="/wiki/Salto,_Uruguay" title="Salto, Uruguay">Salto</a>, where he played youth football at Sportivo Artigas.<sup id="cite_ref-33" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-33">&#91;30&#93;</a></sup> At age seven, he moved with his family (parents and six brothers) to Montevideo, where he played youth football at Urreta.<sup id="cite_ref-34" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-34">&#91;31&#93;</a></sup> When he was a kid, a car ran over his foot, breaking the <a href="/wiki/Fifth_metatarsal_bone" title="Fifth metatarsal bone">fifth metatarsal bone</a>. In spite of the injury, he continued to play.<sup id="cite_ref-35" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-35">&#91;32&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Nacional">Nacional</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Luis_Su%C3%A1rez&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3" title="Edit section: Nacional">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<p>Suárez joined local side <a href="/wiki/Club_Nacional_de_Football" title="Club Nacional de Football">Nacional</a>'s youth team at age 14.<sup id="cite_ref-Pearce_1-2_36-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Pearce_1-2-36">&#91;33&#93;</a></sup> At age 16, Suárez <a href="/wiki/Headbutt" title="Headbutt">headbutted</a> a referee after showing his discontent following a red card, although a sports editor claimed he "accidentally fell into the referee".<sup id="cite_ref-ESPNportrait_37-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ESPNportrait-37">&#91;34&#93;</a></sup> One night, he was caught drinking and partying, prompting his coach to threaten he would never play unless he started playing football more seriously.<sup id="cite_ref-Pearce_1-2_36-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Pearce_1-2-36">&#91;33&#93;</a></sup> In May 2005, at age 18, Suárez made his first-team debut against <a href="/wiki/Atl%C3%A9tico_Junior" title="Atlético Junior">Atlético Junior</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Copa_Libertadores" title="Copa Libertadores">Copa Libertadores</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Pearce_1-2_36-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Pearce_1-2-36">&#91;33&#93;</a></sup> He scored his first goal in September 2005<sup id="cite_ref-personal_bio_38-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-personal_bio-38">&#91;35&#93;</a></sup> and helped Nacional win the <a href="/wiki/2005%E2%80%9306_Uruguayan_Primera_Divisi%C3%B3n" title="200506 Uruguayan Primera División">200506 Uruguayan league</a> with 10 goals in 27 matches.<sup id="cite_ref-football_database_39-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-football_database-39">&#91;36&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Suárez was found by a group of scouts from the Dutch club <a href="/wiki/FC_Groningen" title="FC Groningen">Groningen</a> when they were in Uruguay to scout another player. As they watched, he won and converted a penalty and scored a "wonder goal" against <a href="/wiki/Defensor_Sporting" title="Defensor Sporting">Defensor</a>. After watching only that match, the scouts approached Suárez and said they wanted to buy him, and after the season, Groningen paid Nacional 800,000 for him.<sup id="cite_ref-Pearce_1-2_36-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Pearce_1-2-36">&#91;33&#93;</a></sup> Suárez was thrilled to go to Europe because his then girlfriend, and now wife, Sofía Balbi, had moved to <a href="/wiki/Barcelona" title="Barcelona">Barcelona</a>; they had maintained a long-distance relationship for a year and he wanted to move closer to her.<sup id="cite_ref-ESPNportrait_37-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ESPNportrait-37">&#91;34&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-personal_bio_38-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-personal_bio-38">&#91;35&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Groningen">Groningen</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Luis_Su%C3%A1rez&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4" title="Edit section: Groningen">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Luis_Su%C3%A1rez_cropped.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3a/Luis_Su%C3%A1rez_cropped.jpg/170px-Luis_Su%C3%A1rez_cropped.jpg" decoding="async" width="170" height="202" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3a/Luis_Su%C3%A1rez_cropped.jpg/255px-Luis_Su%C3%A1rez_cropped.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3a/Luis_Su%C3%A1rez_cropped.jpg/340px-Luis_Su%C3%A1rez_cropped.jpg 2x" data-file-width="780" data-file-height="927" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Luis_Su%C3%A1rez_cropped.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Suárez on the training field of <a href="/wiki/FC_Groningen" title="FC Groningen">Groningen</a> in 2006</div></div></div>
<p>Suárez was 19 years old when he joined Groningen. Initially, Suárez struggled because he could not speak Dutch or English, and he played on the second team to adjust to the Dutch game.<sup id="cite_ref-Pearce_1-3_40-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Pearce_1-3-40">&#91;37&#93;</a></sup> His teammate and fellow Uruguayan, <a href="/wiki/Bruno_Silva" title="Bruno Silva">Bruno Silva</a>, helped him settle into living in the Netherlands and playing for a new team.<sup id="cite_ref-Pearce_1-3_40-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Pearce_1-3-40">&#91;37&#93;</a></sup> He worked hard to learn Dutch and his teammates respected him for his efforts with the language.<sup id="cite_ref-Pearce_1-3_40-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Pearce_1-3-40">&#91;37&#93;</a></sup> Suárez scored goals for Groningen, but he also had disciplinary problems; in one five-game stretch in January 2007, he scored four goals but received three <a href="/wiki/Yellow_card_(sports)" class="mw-redirect" title="Yellow card (sports)">yellow cards</a> and one <a href="/wiki/Red_card_(sports)" class="mw-redirect" title="Red card (sports)">red card</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Lyttleton_41-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Lyttleton-41">&#91;38&#93;</a></sup> Suárez especially made his mark in a 43 home win over <a href="/wiki/SBV_Vitesse" title="SBV Vitesse">Vitesse</a>, when with ten minutes to go he subsequently won a penalty and scored two goals.<sup id="cite_ref-42" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-42">&#91;39&#93;</a></sup> Suárez ended with 10 goals in 29 league appearances<sup id="cite_ref-Mathaba_43-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Mathaba-43">&#91;40&#93;</a></sup> to help Groningen finish eighth in the <a href="/wiki/2006%E2%80%9307_Eredivisie" title="200607 Eredivisie">200607 Eredivisie</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Pearce_1-3_40-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Pearce_1-3-40">&#91;37&#93;</a></sup> He also scored in a 42 loss to Serbian club <a href="/wiki/FK_Partizan" title="FK Partizan">Partizan</a> in his <a href="/wiki/2006%E2%80%9307_UEFA_Cup" title="200607 UEFA Cup">European</a> debut on 14 September 2006.<sup id="cite_ref-Pearce_1-3_40-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Pearce_1-3-40">&#91;37&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-44" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-44">&#91;41&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p><a href="/wiki/AFC_Ajax" title="AFC Ajax">Ajax</a> saw potential in Suárez and offered Groningen 3.5&#160;million for him, but Groningen rejected the offer.<sup id="cite_ref-Pearce_1-4_45-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Pearce_1-4-45">&#91;42&#93;</a></sup> Suárez was upset and brought his case to the <a href="/wiki/Royal_Dutch_Football_Association" title="Royal Dutch Football Association">Royal Dutch Football Association</a> (KNVB)'s arbitration committee to try to facilitate the sale.<sup id="cite_ref-Pearce_1-4_45-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Pearce_1-4-45">&#91;42&#93;</a></sup> The arbitration committee ruled against him on 9 August 2007, but that same day, Ajax increased their offer to 7.5&#160;million and Groningen accepted.<sup id="cite_ref-UEFA_Ajax-Groningen_46-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-UEFA_Ajax-Groningen-46">&#91;43&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-:2_47-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-:2-47">&#91;44&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Ajax">Ajax</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Luis_Su%C3%A1rez&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5" title="Edit section: Ajax">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span id="2007.E2.80.9309:_Development_and_breakthrough"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="200709:_Development_and_breakthrough">200709: Development and breakthrough</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Luis_Su%C3%A1rez&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6" title="Edit section: 200709: Development and breakthrough">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h4>
<p>Suárez signed a five-year contract with Ajax<sup id="cite_ref-Pearce_1-4_45-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Pearce_1-4-45">&#91;42&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-:2_47-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-:2-47">&#91;44&#93;</a></sup> and made his club debut in the <a href="/wiki/2007%E2%80%9308_UEFA_Champions_League_qualifying_rounds" title="200708 UEFA Champions League qualifying rounds">UEFA Champions League qualifier</a> against <a href="/wiki/SK_Slavia_Prague" title="SK Slavia Prague">Slavia Prague</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Ajax_departure_summary_48-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Ajax_departure_summary-48">&#91;45&#93;</a></sup> He scored one goal in his Eredivisie debut for the club<sup id="cite_ref-Echo_2-1_49-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Echo_2-1-49">&#91;46&#93;</a></sup> and two goals in his home debut at the <a href="/wiki/Amsterdam_Arena" class="mw-redirect" title="Amsterdam Arena">Amsterdam Arena</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-50" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-50">&#91;47&#93;</a></sup> Ajax finished second in the league table in the <a href="/wiki/2007%E2%80%9308_Eredivisie" title="200708 Eredivisie">200708 season</a><sup id="cite_ref-51" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-51">&#91;48&#93;</a></sup> and Suárez scored 17 goals in 33 league appearances, setting up a blossoming striking partnership with league top scorer <a href="/wiki/Klaas-Jan_Huntelaar" title="Klaas-Jan Huntelaar">Klaas-Jan Huntelaar</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Soccernet_Ajax-Liv_transfer_52-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Soccernet_Ajax-Liv_transfer-52">&#91;49&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>During the <a href="/wiki/2008%E2%80%9309_Eredivisie" title="200809 Eredivisie">200809 season</a>, Ajax head coach <a href="/wiki/Marco_van_Basten" title="Marco van Basten">Marco van Basten</a> noted how Suárez played an important role in many of Ajax's goals, but van Basten was also upset by the number of yellow cards Suárez received.<sup id="cite_ref-Echo_2-1_49-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Echo_2-1-49">&#91;46&#93;</a></sup> Suárez was suspended for one match<sup id="cite_ref-53" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-53">&#91;50&#93;</a></sup> because he was given his seventh yellow card of the season against <a href="/wiki/FC_Utrecht" title="FC Utrecht">Utrecht</a> in a 20 win.<sup id="cite_ref-54" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-54">&#91;51&#93;</a></sup> He was also suspended after a half-time altercation with teammate <a href="/wiki/Albert_Luque" title="Albert Luque">Albert Luque</a> over a <a href="/wiki/Direct_free_kick" class="mw-redirect" title="Direct free kick">free kick</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Lyttleton_41-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Lyttleton-41">&#91;38&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Echo_2-1_49-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Echo_2-1-49">&#91;46&#93;</a></sup> Ajax ended the season in third place.<sup id="cite_ref-55" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-55">&#91;52&#93;</a></sup> Suárez scored 22 goals in 31 league matches<sup id="cite_ref-Echo_2-1_49-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Echo_2-1-49">&#91;46&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Soccernet_Ajax-Liv_transfer_52-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Soccernet_Ajax-Liv_transfer-52">&#91;49&#93;</a></sup> and finished second in scoring tables, one goal behind <a href="/wiki/Mounir_El_Hamdaoui" title="Mounir El Hamdaoui">Mounir El Hamdaoui</a> of <a href="/wiki/AZ_Alkmaar" title="AZ Alkmaar">AZ</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-56" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-56">&#91;53&#93;</a></sup> Suárez was also named Ajax Player of the Year.<sup id="cite_ref-Liverpool_profile_57-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Liverpool_profile-57">&#91;54&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span id="2009.E2.80.9310:_League_top_goalscorer.2C_Eredivisie_winner"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="200910:_League_top_goalscorer,_Eredivisie_winner">200910: League top goalscorer, Eredivisie winner</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Luis_Su%C3%A1rez&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7" title="Edit section: 200910: League top goalscorer, Eredivisie winner">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h4>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:AFC_Ajax_2010.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/36/AFC_Ajax_2010.jpg/220px-AFC_Ajax_2010.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="189" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/36/AFC_Ajax_2010.jpg/330px-AFC_Ajax_2010.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/36/AFC_Ajax_2010.jpg/440px-AFC_Ajax_2010.jpg 2x" data-file-width="615" data-file-height="528" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:AFC_Ajax_2010.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Suárez (with the Ajax <a href="/wiki/Pennant_(sports)" title="Pennant (sports)">pennant</a>) as Ajax <a href="/wiki/Captain_(association_football)" title="Captain (association football)">captain</a> in 2010. Suárez was named captain in the 200910 season.</div></div></div>
<p>Before the <a href="/wiki/2009%E2%80%9310_Eredivisie" title="200910 Eredivisie">200910 season</a>, <a href="/wiki/Martin_Jol" title="Martin Jol">Martin Jol</a> replaced Van Basten as head coach.<sup id="cite_ref-Echo_2-1_49-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Echo_2-1-49">&#91;46&#93;</a></sup> After the departure of Ajax captain <a href="/wiki/Thomas_Vermaelen" title="Thomas Vermaelen">Thomas Vermaelen</a> to <a href="/wiki/Arsenal_F.C." title="Arsenal F.C.">Arsenal</a>, Jol named Suárez team captain.<sup id="cite_ref-Echo_2-2_58-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Echo_2-2-58">&#91;55&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-59" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-59">&#91;56&#93;</a></sup> Suárez started scoring goals early in the season with a hat-trick in a 41 win against <a href="/wiki/RKC_Waalwijk" title="RKC Waalwijk">RKC Waalwijk</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-60" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-60">&#91;57&#93;</a></sup> He had a number of multiple-goal matches throughout the season, including four in wins over <a href="/wiki/%C5%A0K_Slovan_Bratislava" title="K Slovan Bratislava">Slovan Bratislava</a> in the <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Europa_League_2009%E2%80%9310_play-off_round" class="mw-redirect" title="UEFA Europa League 200910 play-off round">UEFA Europe League play-off round</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-61" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-61">&#91;58&#93;</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/VVV-Venlo" title="VVV-Venlo">VVV-Venlo</a><sup id="cite_ref-62" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-62">&#91;59&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-63" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-63">&#91;60&#93;</a></sup> and <a href="/wiki/Roda_JC_Kerkrade" title="Roda JC Kerkrade">Roda JC</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-64" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-64">&#91;61&#93;</a></sup> He scored three in the first half in another win over VVV-Venlo<sup id="cite_ref-65" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-65">&#91;62&#93;</a></sup> and six against <a href="/wiki/WHC_Wezep" title="WHC Wezep">WHC Wezep</a> in the <a href="/wiki/KNVB_Cup" title="KNVB Cup">KNVB Cup</a> as Ajax won by a club-record margin of 141.<sup id="cite_ref-66" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-66">&#91;63&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Suárez scored two goals in the <a href="/wiki/Two-legged_tie" title="Two-legged tie">second leg</a> of the KNVB Cup final and finished as the tournament's top scorer.<sup id="cite_ref-Ajax_wins_Cup_67-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Ajax_wins_Cup-67">&#91;64&#93;</a></sup> Ajax won the Cup final 61 on <a href="/wiki/Aggregate_score#Total_points_series_(aggregate)" class="mw-redirect" title="Aggregate score">aggregate</a> over <a href="/wiki/Feyenoord" title="Feyenoord">Feyenoord</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-Liverpool_profile_57-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Liverpool_profile-57">&#91;54&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Ajax_wins_Cup_67-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Ajax_wins_Cup-67">&#91;64&#93;</a></sup> but they finished second in the league behind <a href="/wiki/FC_Twente" title="FC Twente">Twente</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Echo_2-2_58-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Echo_2-2-58">&#91;55&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Suárez ended the season as the Eredivisie's top scorer with 35 goals in 33 matches, and had 49 goals in all competitions.<sup id="cite_ref-Echo_2-2_58-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Echo_2-2-58">&#91;55&#93;</a></sup> He was named Ajax Player of the Year for the second straight year<sup id="cite_ref-Liverpool_profile_57-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Liverpool_profile-57">&#91;54&#93;</a></sup> and <a href="/wiki/Dutch_Footballer_of_the_Year" title="Dutch Footballer of the Year">Dutch Footballer of the Year</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Liverpool_profile_57-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Liverpool_profile-57">&#91;54&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Echo_2-2_58-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Echo_2-2-58">&#91;55&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-68" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-68">&#91;65&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span id="2010.E2.80.9311:_First_biting_incident"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="201011:_First_biting_incident">201011: First biting incident</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Luis_Su%C3%A1rez&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8" title="Edit section: 201011: First biting incident">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h4>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Suarez_Ajax_captain.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b0/Suarez_Ajax_captain.jpg/220px-Suarez_Ajax_captain.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="212" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b0/Suarez_Ajax_captain.jpg/330px-Suarez_Ajax_captain.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b0/Suarez_Ajax_captain.jpg/440px-Suarez_Ajax_captain.jpg 2x" data-file-width="516" data-file-height="498" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Suarez_Ajax_captain.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Suárez playing for Ajax in a <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Champions_League" title="UEFA Champions League">UEFA Champions League</a> match against <a href="/wiki/FC_Dynamo_Kyiv" title="FC Dynamo Kyiv">Dynamo Kyiv</a> in 2010</div></div></div>
<p>Soon after Suárez returned from his World Cup campaign, he scored his 100th goal for Ajax in a 11 home draw against <a href="/wiki/PAOK_FC" title="PAOK FC">PAOK</a> in a <a href="/wiki/2010%E2%80%9311_UEFA_Champions_League#Third_qualifying_round" title="201011 UEFA Champions League">UEFA Champions League qualifier</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Liverpool_profile_57-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Liverpool_profile-57">&#91;54&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Ajax100_69-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Ajax100-69">&#91;66&#93;</a></sup> This put him in an elite group of players, including <a href="/wiki/Johan_Cruyff" title="Johan Cruyff">Johan Cruyff</a>, Marco van Basten and <a href="/wiki/Dennis_Bergkamp" title="Dennis Bergkamp">Dennis Bergkamp</a>, to score 100 or more goals with the club.<sup id="cite_ref-Echo_2-3_70-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Echo_2-3-70">&#91;67&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Ajax100_69-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Ajax100-69">&#91;66&#93;</a></sup> Suárez continued his scoring run with a hat-trick against <a href="/wiki/De_Graafschap" title="De Graafschap">De Graafschap</a> in a 50 win.<sup id="cite_ref-71" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-71">&#91;68&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 20 November 2010, Suárez bit <a href="/wiki/PSV_Eindhoven" title="PSV Eindhoven">PSV</a>'s <a href="/wiki/Otman_Bakkal" title="Otman Bakkal">Otman Bakkal</a> on the shoulder during a 00 draw. Ajax suspended him for two matches and fined him an undisclosed amount, which the club said they would donate to a "good cause".<sup id="cite_ref-72" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-72">&#91;69&#93;</a></sup> The Dutch daily newspaper <i><a href="/wiki/De_Telegraaf" title="De Telegraaf">De Telegraaf</a></i> branded Suárez the "Cannibal of Ajax".<sup id="cite_ref-Cannibal_of_Ajax_23-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Cannibal_of_Ajax-23">&#91;21&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Echo_2-3_70-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Echo_2-3-70">&#91;67&#93;</a></sup> The KNVB increased Suárez's suspension to seven league matches.<sup id="cite_ref-73" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-73">&#91;70&#93;</a></sup> Suárez apologised for his actions through a video he uploaded to his <a href="/wiki/Facebook" title="Facebook">Facebook</a> page.<sup id="cite_ref-Echo_2-3_70-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Echo_2-3-70">&#91;67&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Liverpool">Liverpool</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Luis_Su%C3%A1rez&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9" title="Edit section: Liverpool">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Transfer">Transfer</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Luis_Su%C3%A1rez&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10" title="Edit section: Transfer">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h4>
<p>During the suspension, Ajax were in contact with other European clubs interested in Suárez. On 28 January 2011, they accepted a 26.5&#160;million (<a href="/wiki/Pound_sterling" title="Pound sterling">£</a>22.8&#160;million) offer for Suárez from <a href="/wiki/Premier_League" title="Premier League">Premier League</a> club <a href="/wiki/Liverpool_F.C." title="Liverpool F.C.">Liverpool</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Echo_2-4_74-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Echo_2-4-74">&#91;71&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-BBCLiverpool_75-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BBCLiverpool-75">&#91;72&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-76" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-76">&#91;73&#93;</a></sup> Despite leaving while suspended, Suárez departed Ajax on good terms, and he was given a farewell sendoff after an Ajax match. During the sendoff, an Ajax coach spoke to him and the crowd and said how the club wished he could stay longer; the crowd applauded their agreement and fireworks followed.<sup id="cite_ref-77" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-77">&#91;74&#93;</a></sup> Ajax ended the <a href="/wiki/2010%E2%80%9311_Eredivisie" title="201011 Eredivisie">201011 season</a> as Eredivisie champions<sup id="cite_ref-78" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-78">&#91;75&#93;</a></sup> and Suárez was given a winner's medal<sup id="cite_ref-football_database_39-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-football_database-39">&#91;36&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-79" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-79">&#91;76&#93;</a></sup> for his 7 goals in 13 appearances.<sup id="cite_ref-Voetbal_80-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Voetbal-80">&#91;77&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 31 January 2011, Suárez signed a five-and-a-half-year deal with Liverpool until 2016,<sup id="cite_ref-Echo_2-4_74-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Echo_2-4-74">&#91;71&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-81" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-81">&#91;78&#93;</a></sup> and was the club's most expensive signing (£22.8&#160;million) until the arrival of <a href="/wiki/Andy_Carroll" title="Andy Carroll">Andy Carroll</a> (£35&#160;million) a few hours later.<sup id="cite_ref-Stoke_debut_82-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Stoke_debut-82">&#91;79&#93;</a></sup> Suárez requested the number seven shirt, which had been worn by Liverpool legends <a href="/wiki/Kenny_Dalglish" title="Kenny Dalglish">Kenny Dalglish</a>, his new manager, <a href="/wiki/Kevin_Keegan" title="Kevin Keegan">Kevin Keegan</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Peter_Beardsley" title="Peter Beardsley">Peter Beardsley</a><sup id="cite_ref-83" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-83">&#91;80&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span id="2011.E2.80.9312:_Early_seasons"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="201112:_Early_seasons">201112: Early seasons</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Luis_Su%C3%A1rez&amp;action=edit&amp;section=11" title="Edit section: 201112: Early seasons">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h4>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Suarez_and_Carroll_crop.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/21/Suarez_and_Carroll_crop.jpg/220px-Suarez_and_Carroll_crop.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="228" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/21/Suarez_and_Carroll_crop.jpg/330px-Suarez_and_Carroll_crop.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/21/Suarez_and_Carroll_crop.jpg/440px-Suarez_and_Carroll_crop.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1063" data-file-height="1103" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Suarez_and_Carroll_crop.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Suárez (left) was signed by Liverpool on the same day as <a href="/wiki/Andy_Carroll" title="Andy Carroll">Andy Carroll</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>Suárez made his Liverpool debut on 2 February against <a href="/wiki/Stoke_City_F.C." title="Stoke City F.C.">Stoke City</a> at <a href="/wiki/Anfield" title="Anfield">Anfield</a> in a 20 win; he came on as a substitute and scored Liverpool's second goal in front of the <a href="/wiki/Spion_Kop_(stadiums)" title="Spion Kop (stadiums)">Kop</a> in the 79th minute.<sup id="cite_ref-Stoke_debut_82-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Stoke_debut-82">&#91;79&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-84" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-84">&#91;81&#93;</a></sup> He was one of Liverpool's best players during his partial season<sup id="cite_ref-Hytner_85-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Hytner-85">&#91;82&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-86" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-86">&#91;83&#93;</a></sup> and helped Liverpool go from 12th in the league in mid-January<sup id="cite_ref-Hytner_85-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Hytner-85">&#91;82&#93;</a></sup> to finish sixth.<sup id="cite_ref-Times_of_India_87-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Times_of_India-87">&#91;84&#93;</a></sup> He finished the <a href="/wiki/2010%E2%80%9311_Premier_League" title="201011 Premier League">201011 season</a> with four goals in 13 games.<sup id="cite_ref-Voetbal_80-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Voetbal-80">&#91;77&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>After winning the Player of the Tournament at the <a href="/wiki/2011_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica" title="2011 Copa América">2011 Copa América</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-88" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-88">&#91;85&#93;</a></sup> Suárez had a disappointing <a href="/wiki/2011%E2%80%9312_Premier_League" title="201112 Premier League">201112</a> season by his standards.<sup id="cite_ref-Pearce2011-12_89-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Pearce2011-12-89">&#91;86&#93;</a></sup> Liverpool finished in eighth place and Suárez scored 11 league goals.<sup id="cite_ref-Pearce2011-12_89-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Pearce2011-12-89">&#91;86&#93;</a></sup> On 26 February, Liverpool won the <a href="/wiki/2011%E2%80%9312_Football_League_Cup" title="201112 Football League Cup">League Cup</a>, defeating <a href="/wiki/Cardiff_City_F.C." title="Cardiff City F.C.">Cardiff City</a> in penalty shootout.<sup id="cite_ref-Bevan_90-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Bevan-90">&#91;87&#93;</a></sup> On 28 April, Suárez scored his first Liverpool <a href="/wiki/List_of_Premier_League_hat-tricks" title="List of Premier League hat-tricks">hat-trick</a> in a 30 win against <a href="/wiki/Norwich_City_F.C" class="mw-redirect" title="Norwich City F.C">Norwich City</a> at <a href="/wiki/Carrow_Road" title="Carrow Road">Carrow Road</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-91" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-91">&#91;88&#93;</a></sup> He finished sixth for the <a href="/wiki/2011_FIFA_Ballon_d%27Or" title="2011 FIFA Ballon d&#39;Or">2011 FIFA Ballon d'Or</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-votingresults_92-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-votingresults-92">&#91;89&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h5><span class="mw-headline" id="Racial_abuse_incident">Racial abuse incident</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Luis_Su%C3%A1rez&amp;action=edit&amp;section=12" title="Edit section: Racial abuse incident">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h5>
<p>The season was marked by an incident in which Suárez was found guilty by a three-man panel from <a href="/wiki/The_Football_Association" title="The Football Association">The Football Association</a> (FA) of racially abusing <a href="/wiki/Patrice_Evra" title="Patrice Evra">Patrice Evra</a> during a match against <a href="/wiki/Manchester_United_F.C." title="Manchester United F.C.">Manchester United</a> in October; he was issued an eight-match suspension and a £40,000 fine.<sup id="cite_ref-racialguilt_30-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-racialguilt-30">&#91;27&#93;</a></sup> Suárez disputed this decision.<sup id="cite_ref-Suarez_statement_31-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Suarez_statement-31">&#91;28&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>After a 11 draw against Manchester United on 15 October 2011, Suárez was accused of racially abusing Evra,<sup id="cite_ref-FA_Evra_93-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FA_Evra-93">&#91;90&#93;</a></sup> and the FA opened up an investigation into the incident.<sup id="cite_ref-FA_Evra_93-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FA_Evra-93">&#91;90&#93;</a></sup> Suárez wrote on his <a href="/wiki/Twitter" title="Twitter">Twitter</a> and Facebook pages that he was upset by the accusation and denied the claims.<sup id="cite_ref-94" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-94">&#91;91&#93;</a></sup> On 16 November, the FA announced it would charge Suárez with "abusive and/or insulting words and/or behaviour contrary to FA rules", including "a reference to the ethnic origin and/or colour and/or race of Patrice Evra". Liverpool later released a statement announcing Suárez would plead innocent, adding they would "remain fully supportive" of him.<sup id="cite_ref-95" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-95">&#91;92&#93;</a></sup> On 20 December, the FA concluded a seven-day hearing, handing Suárez an eight-match ban and a £40,000 fine for racially abusing Evra.<sup id="cite_ref-96" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-96">&#91;93&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-97" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-97">&#91;94&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-RaceGuard_98-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-RaceGuard-98">&#91;95&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>In their next meeting in February, during the pregame handshakes, Suárez avoided shaking Evra's hand, for which Suárez and Dalglish were later forced to apologise.<sup id="cite_ref-99" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-99">&#91;96&#93;</a></sup> Suárez was also banned for one match for <a href="/wiki/Finger_(gesture)" class="mw-redirect" title="Finger (gesture)">making an obscene gesture</a> towards <a href="/wiki/Fulham_F.C." title="Fulham F.C.">Fulham</a> fans.<sup id="cite_ref-100" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-100">&#91;97&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span id="2012.E2.80.9313:_Return_and_individual_success"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="201213:_Return_and_individual_success">201213: Return and individual success</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Luis_Su%C3%A1rez&amp;action=edit&amp;section=13" title="Edit section: 201213: Return and individual success">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h4>
<p>On 7 August 2012, Suárez signed a new long-term contract with Liverpool.<sup id="cite_ref-101" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-101">&#91;98&#93;</a></sup> On 26 August, he scored his first goal of the <a href="/wiki/2012%E2%80%9313_Liverpool_F.C._season" title="201213 Liverpool F.C. season">201213 season</a> in a 22 draw with champions <a href="/wiki/Manchester_City_F.C." title="Manchester City F.C.">Manchester City</a> at Anfield.<sup id="cite_ref-102" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-102">&#91;99&#93;</a></sup> On 29 September 2012, Suárez scored a hat-trick in Liverpool's Premier League fixture away at <a href="/wiki/Norwich_City_F.C" class="mw-redirect" title="Norwich City F.C">Norwich City</a> for the second consecutive season.<sup id="cite_ref-103" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-103">&#91;100&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Luis_Suarez_vs_Arsenal_(cropped).jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f0/Luis_Suarez_vs_Arsenal_%28cropped%29.jpg/170px-Luis_Suarez_vs_Arsenal_%28cropped%29.jpg" decoding="async" width="170" height="227" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f0/Luis_Suarez_vs_Arsenal_%28cropped%29.jpg/255px-Luis_Suarez_vs_Arsenal_%28cropped%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f0/Luis_Suarez_vs_Arsenal_%28cropped%29.jpg/340px-Luis_Suarez_vs_Arsenal_%28cropped%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1203" data-file-height="1605" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Luis_Suarez_vs_Arsenal_(cropped).jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Suárez playing for Liverpool against <a href="/wiki/Arsenal_F.C." title="Arsenal F.C.">Arsenal</a> in January 2013</div></div></div>
<p>On 6 January 2013, Suárez handled the ball before scoring the decisive goal in Liverpool's 21 win over <a href="/wiki/Mansfield_Town_F.C." title="Mansfield Town F.C.">Mansfield Town</a> from the <a href="/wiki/Conference_National" class="mw-redirect" title="Conference National">Conference National</a> in an <a href="/wiki/2012%E2%80%9313_FA_Cup" title="201213 FA Cup">FA Cup</a> third round match. Liverpool's manager <a href="/wiki/Brendan_Rodgers" title="Brendan Rodgers">Brendan Rodgers</a> defended his player by claiming "it's not his job to own up", while Mansfield manager <a href="/wiki/Paul_Cox_(footballer)" title="Paul Cox (footballer)">Paul Cox</a> said he felt "a little bit gutted" by the "instinctive" handball, but admitted he would have accepted a goal scored like that by one of his players.<sup id="cite_ref-104" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-104">&#91;101&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 19 January, Suárez scored his seventh goal in three matches against Norwich, as Liverpool cruised to a 50 home league victory.<sup id="cite_ref-105" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-105">&#91;102&#93;</a></sup> The following week, Suárez captained Liverpool for the first time for the FA Cup fourth round match against <a href="/wiki/Oldham_Athletic_A.F.C." title="Oldham Athletic A.F.C.">Oldham Athletic</a>; Liverpool lost 23.<sup id="cite_ref-106" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-106">&#91;103&#93;</a></sup> On 2 March, Suárez scored a hat-trick against <a href="/wiki/Wigan_Athletic_F.C." title="Wigan Athletic F.C.">Wigan Athletic</a>, leading Liverpool to a dominant 40 victory at the <a href="/wiki/DW_Stadium" title="DW Stadium">DW Stadium</a>. In so doing, he became only the third Liverpool player to score 20 Premier League goals in a single season after <a href="/wiki/Robbie_Fowler" title="Robbie Fowler">Robbie Fowler</a> and <a href="/wiki/Fernando_Torres" title="Fernando Torres">Fernando Torres</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-107" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-107">&#91;104&#93;</a></sup> On 10 March, Suárez scored his 50th goal in all competitions since joining <i>the Reds</i> by scoring the opener in a 32 home victory over <a href="/wiki/Tottenham_Hotspur_F.C." title="Tottenham Hotspur F.C.">Tottenham Hotspur</a>, ending Spurs' 12-match unbeaten run. He was also named man of the match for his performance after he won the decisive penalty which <a href="/wiki/Steven_Gerrard" title="Steven Gerrard">Steven Gerrard</a> converted.
</p><p>At the end of the season, Suárez was one of six players named on the shortlist for <a href="/wiki/PFA_Players%27_Player_of_the_Year" title="PFA Players&#39; Player of the Year">PFA Players' Player of the Year</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-108" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-108">&#91;105&#93;</a></sup> Suárez finished second in the final ballot behind <a href="/wiki/Gareth_Bale" title="Gareth Bale">Gareth Bale</a> of Tottenham<sup id="cite_ref-pfa_109-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-pfa-109">&#91;106&#93;</a></sup> and was named in the <a href="/wiki/PFA_Team_of_the_Year" title="PFA Team of the Year">PFA Team of the Year</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-pfa_109-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-pfa-109">&#91;106&#93;</a></sup> He was second-<a href="/wiki/2012%E2%80%9313_Premier_League#Top_scorers" title="201213 Premier League">top goalscorer</a> in the Premier League for <a href="/wiki/2012%E2%80%9313_Premier_League" title="201213 Premier League">201213</a> with 23 goals and Liverpool's top scorer in all competitions with 30 goals.<sup id="cite_ref-110" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-110">&#91;107&#93;</a></sup> On 28 May 2013, he was named as Liverpool's player of the season after receiving 64% of votes in a poll of the club's supporters.<sup id="cite_ref-111" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-111">&#91;108&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Luis_Suarez_free_kick_v_Zenit.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/30/Luis_Suarez_free_kick_v_Zenit.jpg/220px-Luis_Suarez_free_kick_v_Zenit.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="150" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/30/Luis_Suarez_free_kick_v_Zenit.jpg/330px-Luis_Suarez_free_kick_v_Zenit.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/30/Luis_Suarez_free_kick_v_Zenit.jpg/440px-Luis_Suarez_free_kick_v_Zenit.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2048" data-file-height="1401" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Luis_Suarez_free_kick_v_Zenit.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Suárez about to score a 35-yard free kick against <a href="/wiki/FC_Zenit_Saint_Petersburg" title="FC Zenit Saint Petersburg">Zenit Saint Petersburg</a>, his second goal in a 31 win, March 2013</div></div></div>
<h5><span class="mw-headline" id="Second_biting_incident">Second biting incident</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Luis_Su%C3%A1rez&amp;action=edit&amp;section=14" title="Edit section: Second biting incident">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h5>
<p>On 21 April 2013, during a 22 draw with <a href="/wiki/Chelsea_F.C" class="mw-redirect" title="Chelsea F.C">Chelsea</a> in a Premier League match at Anfield, Suárez bit <a href="/wiki/Branislav_Ivanovi%C4%87" title="Branislav Ivanovi">Branislav Ivanovi</a>; this was the second time Suárez had bitten an opponent.<sup id="cite_ref-Gaines_112-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Gaines-112">&#91;109&#93;</a></sup> It was not noticed by the officials, and Suárez scored an equaliser in injury time.<sup id="cite_ref-BranBite_24-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BranBite-24">&#91;22&#93;</a></sup> The bite prompted <a href="/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_the_United_Kingdom" title="Prime Minister of the United Kingdom">UK Prime Minister</a> <a href="/wiki/David_Cameron" title="David Cameron">David Cameron</a> to call on the FA to take a hard line with Suárez: the FA charged him with violent conduct and he was fined an undisclosed sum by his club.<sup id="cite_ref-Cameron_113-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Cameron-113">&#91;110&#93;</a></sup> Contrary to claims from Suárez, Ivanovi did not accept an apology.<sup id="cite_ref-Cameron_113-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Cameron-113">&#91;110&#93;</a></sup> Suárez accepted the violent conduct charge but denied the FA's claim the standard punishment of three matches was clearly insufficient for his offence.<sup id="cite_ref-114" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-114">&#91;111&#93;</a></sup> A three-man independent panel appointed by the FA decided on a ten-game ban for Suárez, who did not appeal the ban; the panel criticised Suárez for not appreciating "the seriousness" of the incident when he argued against a long ban. The panel also wanted to send a "strong message that such deplorable behaviours do not have a place in football", while noting that "all players in the higher level of the game are seen as role models, have the duty to act professionally and responsibly, and set the highest example of good conduct to the rest of the game  especially to young players".<sup id="cite_ref-115" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-115">&#91;112&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 31 May 2013, Suárez said he would be seeking an exit from Liverpool in the summer, citing excessive media attention on his family as a reason for wanting to leave.<sup id="cite_ref-116" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-116">&#91;113&#93;</a></sup> On 6 August, after Liverpool had rejected a bid of <a href="/wiki/Pounds_sterling" class="mw-redirect" title="Pounds sterling">£</a>40,000,001 for the player from Arsenal, Suárez reiterated his wish to leave Liverpool and said Liverpool had previously promised to allow him a transfer if the club failed to qualify for the <a href="/wiki/2013%E2%80%9314_UEFA_Champions_League" title="201314 UEFA Champions League">201314 UEFA Champions League</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-117" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-117">&#91;114&#93;</a></sup> The following day, Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers said Liverpool had not broken any promises to Suárez and that the player had shown "total disrespect" for the club.<sup id="cite_ref-alone_118-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-alone-118">&#91;115&#93;</a></sup> After this incident, the British press reported that Suárez had been instructed to train away from the Liverpool first-team squad by Rodgers.<sup id="cite_ref-alone_118-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-alone-118">&#91;115&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-119" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-119">&#91;116&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-120" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-120">&#91;117&#93;</a></sup> On 8 August, Liverpool owner <a href="/wiki/John_W._Henry" title="John W. Henry">John W. Henry</a> stated that Suárez would not be allowed to leave the club.<sup id="cite_ref-121" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-121">&#91;118&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span id="2013.E2.80.9314:_European_Golden_Shoe_and_departure"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="201314:_European_Golden_Shoe_and_departure">201314: European Golden Shoe and departure</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Luis_Su%C3%A1rez&amp;action=edit&amp;section=15" title="Edit section: 201314: European Golden Shoe and departure">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h4>
<p>On 14 August, Suárez appeared to reverse his position about wanting to leave the club, with reports stating he wanted to stay at the club and that he was possibly going to sign a contract extension, citing the support from Liverpool supporters as the reason for his unexpected turnaround.<sup id="cite_ref-122" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-122">&#91;119&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-123" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-123">&#91;120&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-124" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-124">&#91;121&#93;</a></sup> Suárez returned to first-team training two days later after "offer[ing] contrition" to his teammates but reportedly not apologising to his manager.<sup id="cite_ref-125" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-125">&#91;122&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 25 September, Suárez returned to the Liverpool team after his suspension to make his first appearance of the <a href="/wiki/2013%E2%80%9314_Liverpool_F.C._season" title="201314 Liverpool F.C. season">201314 season</a> in a <a href="/wiki/2013%E2%80%9314_Football_League_Cup" title="201314 Football League Cup">League Cup</a> third round tie against Manchester United at <a href="/wiki/Old_Trafford" title="Old Trafford">Old Trafford</a>, losing 10.<sup id="cite_ref-126" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-126">&#91;123&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-127" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-127">&#91;124&#93;</a></sup> On 29 September, Suárez made his first <a href="/wiki/2013%E2%80%9314_Premier_League" title="201314 Premier League">Premier League</a> appearance of the season, scoring twice as Liverpool defeated <a href="/wiki/Sunderland_A.F.C." title="Sunderland A.F.C.">Sunderland</a> 31 at the <a href="/wiki/Stadium_of_Light" title="Stadium of Light">Stadium of Light</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-128" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-128">&#91;125&#93;</a></sup> On 5 October, Suárez made his first appearance of the season at Anfield, where he scored Liverpool's opening goal in a 31 win against <a href="/wiki/Crystal_Palace_F.C." title="Crystal Palace F.C.">Crystal Palace</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-129" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-129">&#91;126&#93;</a></sup> On 26 October, he scored his fourth Premier League hat-trick, his first at Anfield, in a 41 defeat of <a href="/wiki/West_Bromwich_Albion_F.C." title="West Bromwich Albion F.C.">West Bromwich Albion</a>. According to the <a href="/wiki/BBC" title="BBC">BBC</a>, he has <a href="/wiki/List_of_Premier_League_hat-tricks" title="List of Premier League hat-tricks">scored a hat-trick</a> every 20.3 Premier League matches, "the best rate of all 46 players to have scored more than one treble" in the top tier.<sup id="cite_ref-BBC_130-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BBC-130">&#91;127&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="quotebox pullquote floatright" style="width:27%; ;"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1012376600"/>
<div class="quotebox-quote left-aligned" style="">"He [Suárez] has shown in his time at Liverpool in the last year or so that he is near unplayable. He on his own can occupy a back four with his movement and his cleverness."</div>
<p><cite class="left-aligned" style=""> <a href="/wiki/Brendan_Rodgers" title="Brendan Rodgers">Brendan Rodgers</a>, Liverpool manager, in a season when Suárez was player of the year.<sup id="cite_ref-131" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-131">&#91;128&#93;</a></sup></cite>
</p>
</div>
<p>On 4 December, Suárez scored four goals against Norwich City in a 51 home win.<sup id="cite_ref-132" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-132">&#91;129&#93;</a></sup> He became the first player in Premier League history to score three hat-tricks against the same club, and took his scoring record against Norwich to 11 goals in 5 matches.<sup id="cite_ref-133" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-133">&#91;130&#93;</a></sup> On 15 December, Suárez captained Liverpool for the first time in a Premier League match against Tottenham Hotspur.<sup id="cite_ref-134" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-134">&#91;131&#93;</a></sup> He both scored and assisted twice as the team recorded a 50 win at <a href="/wiki/White_Hart_Lane" title="White Hart Lane">White Hart Lane</a> to close the gap on league leaders Arsenal to two points.<sup id="cite_ref-135" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-135">&#91;132&#93;</a></sup> The following day, Suárez was named the <a href="/wiki/Football_Supporters%27_Federation" title="Football Supporters&#39; Federation">Football Supporters' Federation Player of the Year</a> for 2013.<sup id="cite_ref-136" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-136">&#91;133&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-137" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-137">&#91;134&#93;</a></sup> On 20 December, Suárez signed a new four-and-a-half-year contract with Liverpool.<sup id="cite_ref-138" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-138">&#91;135&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-139" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-139">&#91;136&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-140" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-140">&#91;137&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 1 January 2014, by scoring in a 20 home win over <a href="/wiki/Hull_City_A.F.C." title="Hull City A.F.C.">Hull City</a>, Suárez became the first Liverpool player to score 20 or more goals in successive Premier League seasons since Robbie Fowler in <a href="/wiki/1994%E2%80%9395_Liverpool_F.C._season" title="199495 Liverpool F.C. season">199495</a> and <a href="/wiki/1995%E2%80%9396_Liverpool_F.C._season" title="199596 Liverpool F.C. season">199596</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-141" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-141">&#91;138&#93;</a></sup> He equalled <a href="/wiki/Andy_Cole" title="Andy Cole">Andy Cole</a>'s Premier League record for the earliest date to reach the 20-goal mark, but set a new record low of 15 matches.<sup id="cite_ref-142" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-142">&#91;139&#93;</a></sup> His strike partnership this season with <a href="/wiki/Daniel_Sturridge" title="Daniel Sturridge">Daniel Sturridge</a> has earned them a nickname "SAS", <i>i.e.</i>, <i>Sturridge and Suárez".<sup id="cite_ref-143" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-143">&#91;140&#93;</a></sup></i>
</p><p>On 1 March, Suárez made his 100th Premier League appearance, scoring in a 30 win over <a href="/wiki/Southampton_F.C." title="Southampton F.C.">Southampton</a> at <a href="/wiki/St_Mary%27s_Stadium" title="St Mary&#39;s Stadium">St Mary's Stadium</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-144" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-144">&#91;141&#93;</a></sup> In the following fixture, he scored his 25th league goal of the season as Liverpool defeated Manchester United at Old Trafford for the first time since 2009 by a convincing three-goal margin.<sup id="cite_ref-145" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-145">&#91;142&#93;</a></sup> On 22 March, Suárez scored his sixth <a href="/wiki/List_of_Premier_League_hat-tricks" title="List of Premier League hat-tricks">Premier League hat-trick</a>, and third of the season, in a 63 win over <a href="/wiki/Cardiff_City_F.C." title="Cardiff City F.C.">Cardiff City</a> at the <a href="/wiki/Cardiff_City_Stadium" title="Cardiff City Stadium">Cardiff City Stadium</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-146" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-146">&#91;143&#93;</a></sup> On 30 March, he broke Robbie Fowler's club record of 28 goals in a Premier League season in a 40 home win against Tottenham which took Liverpool top of the league with six matches remaining.<sup id="cite_ref-147" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-147">&#91;144&#93;</a></sup> On 20 April, he scored in a 32 win at Norwich to become the first Liverpool player to score 30 league goals in a season since <a href="/wiki/Ian_Rush" title="Ian Rush">Ian Rush</a> in <a href="/wiki/1986%E2%80%9387_Liverpool_F.C._season" title="198687 Liverpool F.C. season">198687</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-148" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-148">&#91;145&#93;</a></sup> This also made him the seventh player to score 30 goals in a Premier League season, following Andy Cole, <a href="/wiki/Alan_Shearer" title="Alan Shearer">Alan Shearer</a>, <a href="/wiki/Kevin_Phillips_(footballer)" title="Kevin Phillips (footballer)">Kevin Phillips</a>, <a href="/wiki/Thierry_Henry" title="Thierry Henry">Thierry Henry</a>, <a href="/wiki/Cristiano_Ronaldo" title="Cristiano Ronaldo">Cristiano Ronaldo</a> and <a href="/wiki/Robin_van_Persie" title="Robin van Persie">Robin van Persie</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-149" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-149">&#91;146&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 18 April, Suárez was named as one of the six players nominated for the <a href="/wiki/PFA_Player_of_the_Year" class="mw-redirect" title="PFA Player of the Year">PFA Player of the Year</a> award for the second consecutive season.<sup id="cite_ref-150" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-150">&#91;147&#93;</a></sup> On 27 April, he won the award, becoming the first non-European to win the award.<sup id="cite_ref-Guardian_151-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Guardian-151">&#91;148&#93;</a></sup> On 5 May 2014, Suárez was named as the <a href="/wiki/FWA_Footballer_of_the_Year" title="FWA Footballer of the Year">Football Association Writers</a> Player of the Year.<sup id="cite_ref-152" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-152">&#91;149&#93;</a></sup> He finished the season with 31 goals in 33 matches, winning the <a href="/wiki/Premier_League_Golden_Boot" title="Premier League Golden Boot">Premier League Golden Boot</a>, with Sturridge as runner-up,<sup id="cite_ref-153" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-153">&#91;150&#93;</a></sup> as Liverpool came second in the league and returned to the UEFA Champions League. Suárez also won the Barclay's <a href="/wiki/Premier_League_Player_of_the_Season" title="Premier League Player of the Season">Premier League Player of the Season</a> award.<sup id="cite_ref-154" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-154">&#91;151&#93;</a></sup> As the Premier League's top scorer with 31 goals, he also shared the <a href="/wiki/European_Golden_Shoe" title="European Golden Shoe">European Golden Shoe</a> with Cristiano Ronaldo. On 21 May 2014, Suárez ranked number one on "Europe's most influential player" list of the year, ahead of <a href="/wiki/Lionel_Messi" title="Lionel Messi">Lionel Messi</a>, <a href="/wiki/Zlatan_Ibrahimovi%C4%87" title="Zlatan Ibrahimovi">Zlatan Ibrahimovi</a> and Cristiano Ronaldo, according to a study by <a href="/wiki/50_Most_Influential_(Bloomberg_Markets_ranking)" class="mw-redirect" title="50 Most Influential (Bloomberg Markets ranking)">Bloomberg</a> of the <a href="/wiki/European_Professional_Football_Leagues" class="mw-redirect" title="European Professional Football Leagues">top five European leagues</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-BSports_Power_50_155-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BSports_Power_50-155">&#91;152&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Barcelona">Barcelona</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Luis_Su%C3%A1rez&amp;action=edit&amp;section=16" title="Edit section: Barcelona">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Signing_and_suspension">Signing and suspension</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Luis_Su%C3%A1rez&amp;action=edit&amp;section=17" title="Edit section: Signing and suspension">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h4>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:202px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Luis_Suarez_FCB_2014.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0a/Luis_Suarez_FCB_2014.jpg/200px-Luis_Suarez_FCB_2014.jpg" decoding="async" width="200" height="267" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0a/Luis_Suarez_FCB_2014.jpg/300px-Luis_Suarez_FCB_2014.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0a/Luis_Suarez_FCB_2014.jpg/400px-Luis_Suarez_FCB_2014.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1200" data-file-height="1600" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Luis_Suarez_FCB_2014.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Suárez making his Barcelona debut against <a href="/wiki/Club_Le%C3%B3n" title="Club León">Club León</a> in August 2014. After serving his four-month suspension for biting at the 2014 World Cup he made his competitive debut for the club on 25 October.</div></div></div>
<p>On 11 July 2014, Suárez agreed with <a href="/wiki/FC_Barcelona" title="FC Barcelona">Barcelona</a> on a five-year contract for an undisclosed transfer fee.<sup id="cite_ref-156" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-156">&#91;153&#93;</a></sup> However, according to a leaked document by <a href="/wiki/Football_Leaks" title="Football Leaks">Football Leaks</a>, the fee was £64.98&#160;million (82.3&#160;million), making him <a href="/wiki/List_of_most_expensive_association_football_transfers" title="List of most expensive association football transfers">one of the most expensive players</a> in world football history.<sup id="cite_ref-Revealed:_How_much_Luis_Suarez_really_cost_Barcelona_14-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Revealed:_How_much_Luis_Suarez_really_cost_Barcelona-14">&#91;13&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-157" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-157">&#91;154&#93;</a></sup> <i>Barça</i> confirmed Suárez would wear the number 9 shirt for the <a href="/wiki/2014%E2%80%9315_FC_Barcelona_season" title="201415 FC Barcelona season">201415 season</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-158" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-158">&#91;155&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Suárez missed the first part of the season after being found guilty of biting Italian player <a href="/wiki/Giorgio_Chiellini" title="Giorgio Chiellini">Giorgio Chiellini</a> at the <a href="/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2014 FIFA World Cup">2014 FIFA World Cup</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-FIFABan_159-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FIFABan-159">&#91;156&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Ban2014_160-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Ban2014-160">&#91;157&#93;</a></sup> As part of the suspension, he was banned from all "football-related activities", including training for Barcelona, for four months (until 26 October). He was also banned from entering any stadium, even as a spectator, during the same period.<sup id="cite_ref-FIFABan_159-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FIFABan-159">&#91;156&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Ban2014_160-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Ban2014-160">&#91;157&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 24 July, Suárez and his lawyers filed an appeal with the <a href="/wiki/Court_of_Arbitration_for_Sport" title="Court of Arbitration for Sport">Court of Arbitration for Sport</a> (CAS) and requested the sanctions be reduced or the suspension to be lifted.<sup id="cite_ref-cas_161-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-cas-161">&#91;158&#93;</a></sup> The parties were heard at a hearing which took place at the CAS offices in <a href="/wiki/Lausanne" title="Lausanne">Lausanne</a>, Switzerland, on 8 August.<sup id="cite_ref-cas2_162-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-cas2-162">&#91;159&#93;</a></sup> Six days later, the CAS confirmed the ban imposed by <a href="/wiki/FIFA" title="FIFA">FIFA</a> against Suárez, who remained suspended from football for four months, as well as a nine-match ban in internationals, the first of which was served in the <a href="/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup_knockout_stage#Colombia_vs_Uruguay" title="2014 FIFA World Cup knockout stage">Uruguay's round of 16 match against Colombia</a> in the 2014 World Cup. However, the CAS removed the player's "football-related activities" ban and was allowed to train with Barcelona. As a result of this ban, Suárez was banned from participating in the <a href="/wiki/2015_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica" title="2015 Copa América">2015 Copa América</a>.
</p><p>The CAS permitted Suárez to play in friendly matches, and he made his Barcelona debut on 18 August against <a href="/wiki/Club_Le%C3%B3n" title="Club León">Club León</a> of Mexico at the <a href="/wiki/Camp_Nou" title="Camp Nou">Camp Nou</a>, replacing <a href="/wiki/Rafinha_(footballer,_born_February_1993)" title="Rafinha (footballer, born February 1993)">Rafinha</a> for the final 14 minutes of an eventual 60 win in the <a href="/wiki/Gamper_Trophy" class="mw-redirect" title="Gamper Trophy">Gamper Trophy</a>. Fellow forwards Lionel Messi and <a href="/wiki/Neymar" title="Neymar">Neymar</a> had already been substituted off by the time Suárez took to the pitch.<sup id="cite_ref-163" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-163">&#91;160&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span id="2014.E2.80.9315:_MSN_trio_and_treble_winner"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="201415:_MSN_trio_and_treble_winner">201415: MSN trio and treble winner</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Luis_Su%C3%A1rez&amp;action=edit&amp;section=18" title="Edit section: 201415: MSN trio and treble winner">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h4>
<p>Suárez made his competitive debut for Barcelona on 25 October, starting in attack with Lionel Messi and Neymar away to <a href="/wiki/Real_Madrid_C.F." class="mw-redirect" title="Real Madrid C.F.">Real Madrid</a> in <i><a href="/wiki/El_Cl%C3%A1sico" title="El Clásico">El Clásico</a></i>.<sup id="cite_ref-Clasico_164-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Clasico-164">&#91;161&#93;</a></sup> Although he set up Neymar for the opening goal in the fourth minute, Suárez was substituted in the second half and Barcelona lost 31.<sup id="cite_ref-Clasico_164-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Clasico-164">&#91;161&#93;</a></sup> He scored his first goal for the club on 26 November in a 40 win at <a href="/wiki/APOEL_FC" title="APOEL FC">APOEL</a> in the <a href="/wiki/2014%E2%80%9315_UEFA_Champions_League" title="201415 UEFA Champions League">UEFA Champions League</a> <a href="/wiki/2014%E2%80%9315_UEFA_Champions_League_group_stage" title="201415 UEFA Champions League group stage">group stage</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-165" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-165">&#91;162&#93;</a></sup> On 20 December, he scored his first league goal for the club in his eighth <a href="/wiki/La_Liga" title="La Liga">La Liga</a> match, contributing to a 50 home win against <a href="/wiki/C%C3%B3rdoba_CF" title="Córdoba CF">Córdoba</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-166" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-166">&#91;163&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 24 February 2015, Suárez scored twice as <i>Barça</i> defeated English champions <a href="/wiki/Manchester_City_F.C." title="Manchester City F.C.">Manchester City</a> 21 in the first leg of their UEFA Champions League <a href="/wiki/2014%E2%80%9315_UEFA_Champions_League_knockout_stage#Round_of_16" class="mw-redirect" title="201415 UEFA Champions League knockout stage">round of 16</a> tie.<sup id="cite_ref-167" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-167">&#91;164&#93;</a></sup> On 4 March, he scored in Barcelona's 31 <a href="/wiki/2014%E2%80%9315_Copa_del_Rey" title="201415 Copa del Rey">Copa del Rey</a> semi-final win over <a href="/wiki/Villarreal_CF" title="Villarreal CF">Villarreal</a> to qualify the club for its 37th <a href="/wiki/Copa_del_Rey" title="Copa del Rey">Spanish Cup</a> <a href="/wiki/2015_Copa_del_Rey_Final" title="2015 Copa del Rey Final">final</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-168" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-168">&#91;165&#93;</a></sup> On 8 March, Suárez scored twice in a 61 home win over <a href="/wiki/Rayo_Vallecano" title="Rayo Vallecano">Rayo Vallecano</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-169" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-169">&#91;166&#93;</a></sup> On 22 March 2015, Suárez scored the winning goal for Barcelona in the 21 victory over Real Madrid at <a href="/wiki/Camp_Nou" title="Camp Nou">Camp Nou</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-El_Clasico_170-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-El_Clasico-170">&#91;167&#93;</a></sup> In the post-match press conference, his coach <a href="/wiki/Luis_Enrique_(footballer)" class="mw-redirect" title="Luis Enrique (footballer)">Luis Enrique</a> lauded Suárez, saying, "Very few players can score a goal like he did, and that is why we signed him. He can decide games. He's a pure scorer, who needs very little to finish."<sup id="cite_ref-El_Clasico_170-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-El_Clasico-170">&#91;167&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 15 April, Suárez scored two goals in a 31 UEFA Champions League quarter-final first leg victory over <a href="/wiki/Paris_Saint-Germain_F.C." title="Paris Saint-Germain F.C.">Paris Saint-Germain</a> at the <a href="/wiki/Parc_des_Princes" title="Parc des Princes">Parc des Princes</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-171" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-171">&#91;168&#93;</a></sup> He <a href="/wiki/Nutmeg_(football)" class="mw-redirect" title="Nutmeg (football)">nutmegged</a> PSG defender <a href="/wiki/David_Luiz" title="David Luiz">David Luiz</a> twice before scoring both goals.<sup id="cite_ref-172" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-172">&#91;169&#93;</a></sup> On 2 May, he scored his first hat-trick for the club, in 80 win at Córdoba.<sup id="cite_ref-173" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-173">&#91;170&#93;</a></sup> On 12 May, Suárez set up both of Neymar's goal in the second leg of Barcelona's UEFA Champions League semi-final tie as they went on to win 5-3 on aggregate against <a href="/wiki/Bayern_Munich" class="mw-redirect" title="Bayern Munich">Bayern Munich</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-174" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-174">&#91;171&#93;</a></sup> Suárez scored in the <a href="/wiki/2015_UEFA_Champions_League_Final" title="2015 UEFA Champions League Final">Champions League final</a> against <a href="/wiki/Juventus_F.C." title="Juventus F.C.">Juventus</a> on 6 June in <a href="/wiki/Berlin" title="Berlin">Berlin</a>, putting the team back into the lead in an eventual 31 win by converting the rebound after <a href="/wiki/Gianluigi_Buffon" title="Gianluigi Buffon">Gianluigi Buffon</a> saved from Messi. The win sealed a <a href="/wiki/Treble_(association_football)" title="Treble (association football)">treble</a> for the team.<sup id="cite_ref-175" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-175">&#91;172&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Suárez ended his first season at Barcelona with 25 goals and 20 assists in all competitions.<sup id="cite_ref-176" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-176">&#91;173&#93;</a></sup> The Barcelona attacking trio of Messi, Suárez and Neymar, dubbed "MSN", ended with 122 goals, the most in a season for an attacking trio in Spanish football history.<sup id="cite_ref-MSN_record_177-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-MSN_record-177">&#91;174&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
