<h4><span id="2015.E2.80.9317:_Second_European_Golden_Shoe.2C_domestic_success"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="201517:_Second_European_Golden_Shoe,_domestic_success">201517: Second European Golden Shoe, domestic success</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Luis_Su%C3%A1rez&amp;action=edit&amp;section=19" title="Edit section: 201517: Second European Golden Shoe, domestic success">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h4>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:2015_UEFA_Super_Cup_79.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4b/2015_UEFA_Super_Cup_79.jpg/220px-2015_UEFA_Super_Cup_79.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="147" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4b/2015_UEFA_Super_Cup_79.jpg/330px-2015_UEFA_Super_Cup_79.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4b/2015_UEFA_Super_Cup_79.jpg/440px-2015_UEFA_Super_Cup_79.jpg 2x" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="601" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:2015_UEFA_Super_Cup_79.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Suárez strikes against <a href="/wiki/Sevilla_FC" title="Sevilla FC">Sevilla</a> in the <a href="/wiki/2015_UEFA_Super_Cup" title="2015 UEFA Super Cup">2015 UEFA Super Cup</a></div></div></div>
<p>Suárez opened the <a href="/wiki/2015%E2%80%9316_FC_Barcelona_season" title="201516 FC Barcelona season">201516 season</a> by scoring and assisting a goal in Barcelona's 54 <a href="/wiki/Overtime_(sports)#Association_football" title="Overtime (sports)">extra time</a> victory over <a href="/wiki/Sevilla_FC" title="Sevilla FC">Sevilla</a> in the <a href="/wiki/2015_UEFA_Super_Cup" title="2015 UEFA Super Cup">2015 UEFA Super Cup</a>, on 11 August 2015.<sup id="cite_ref-178" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-178">&#91;175&#93;</a></sup> The next day, he was named one of the three finalists for the <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Best_Player_in_Europe_Award#201415" class="mw-redirect" title="UEFA Best Player in Europe Award">2015 UEFA Best Player in Europe Award</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Best_Player_in_Europe_179-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Best_Player_in_Europe-179">&#91;176&#93;</a></sup> On 31 October, Suárez scored in a 20 away win against <a href="/wiki/Getafe_CF" title="Getafe CF">Getafe</a> after being assisted with a backheel from <a href="/wiki/Sergi_Roberto" title="Sergi Roberto">Sergi Roberto</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-300_goals_11-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-300_goals-11">&#91;10&#93;</a></sup> This was his 11th goal of the season and his 300th senior career goal.<sup id="cite_ref-300_goals_11-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-300_goals-11">&#91;10&#93;</a></sup> On 21 November, Suárez scored twice in Barcelona's 40 away win against Real Madrid.<sup id="cite_ref-180" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-180">&#91;177&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 17 December, Suárez scored all three goals as Barcelona defeated Chinese club <a href="/wiki/Guangzhou_Evergrande_Taobao_F.C." class="mw-redirect" title="Guangzhou Evergrande Taobao F.C.">Guangzhou Evergrande</a> 30 in the <a href="/wiki/2015_FIFA_Club_World_Cup" title="2015 FIFA Club World Cup">2015 FIFA Club World Cup</a> semi-final in <a href="/wiki/Yokohama" title="Yokohama">Yokohama</a>, Japan, becoming the first player to score a hat-trick in <a href="/wiki/FIFA_Club_World_Cup" title="FIFA Club World Cup">the competition</a>'s history.<sup id="cite_ref-181" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-181">&#91;178&#93;</a></sup> He then scored twice in Barcelona's 30 win over Argentine club <a href="/wiki/Club_Atl%C3%A9tico_River_Plate" title="Club Atlético River Plate">River Plate</a> in <a href="/wiki/2015_FIFA_Club_World_Cup_Final" title="2015 FIFA Club World Cup Final">the final</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-182" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-182">&#91;179&#93;</a></sup> finishing the tournament as top scorer with five goals and being named the best player of the competition.<sup id="cite_ref-CWC_awards_183-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-CWC_awards-183">&#91;180&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 3 February 2016, Suárez scored four goals in a 70 <a href="/wiki/2015%E2%80%9316_Copa_del_Rey" title="201516 Copa del Rey">Copa del Rey</a> win against <a href="/wiki/Valencia_CF" title="Valencia CF">Valencia</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-184" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-184">&#91;181&#93;</a></sup> On 16 March, he scored an acrobatic goal as Barcelona beat <a href="/wiki/Arsenal_F.C." title="Arsenal F.C.">Arsenal</a> 31 in the second leg of their <a href="/wiki/2015%E2%80%9316_UEFA_Champions_League" title="201516 UEFA Champions League">Champions League</a> round of 16 tie.<sup id="cite_ref-185" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-185">&#91;182&#93;</a></sup> On 5 April, he scored both of Barcelona's goals in a 21 comeback victory over Atlético Madrid during their first leg of the quarter-finals,<sup id="cite_ref-186" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-186">&#91;183&#93;</a></sup> though Barcelona were still eliminated from the competition following defeat in the second leg.<sup id="cite_ref-187" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-187">&#91;184&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 20 April, Suárez again scored four times in a match, as well as assisting three further goals for teammates, as <i>Barça</i> won 80 away at <a href="/wiki/Deportivo_de_La_Coru%C3%B1a" title="Deportivo de La Coruña">Deportivo La Coruña</a> in La Liga. Only three days later, he scored another four goals in a 60 home win over <a href="/wiki/Sporting_de_Gij%C3%B3n" title="Sporting de Gijón">Sporting Gijón</a>, becoming the first player to score four times in back-to-back matches in the history of La Liga.<sup id="cite_ref-188" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-188">&#91;185&#93;</a></sup> On 30 April, Suárez became only the second player in the history of the club to reach the milestone of 35 goals in a single league season.<sup id="cite_ref-189" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-189">&#91;186&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-190" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-190">&#91;187&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On the final day of the <a href="/wiki/2015%E2%80%9316_La_Liga" title="201516 La Liga">201516 La Liga</a> season, Suárez scored a hat-trick in a 30 victory at <a href="/wiki/Granada_CF" title="Granada CF">Granada</a>, securing a second consecutive <a href="/wiki/List_of_Spanish_football_champions" title="List of Spanish football champions">Spanish championship</a> for <i>Barça</i> and registering 40 league goals for the season to win his first <a href="/wiki/Pichichi_Trophy" title="Pichichi Trophy">Pichichi Trophy</a> and a second <a href="/wiki/European_Golden_Shoe" title="European Golden Shoe">European Golden Shoe</a>. Suárez also became the first player since 2009 other than Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo to win both the Pichichi and the Golden Shoe in a season.<sup id="cite_ref-191" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-191">&#91;188&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-192" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-192">&#91;189&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-193" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-193">&#91;190&#93;</a></sup> Fourteen of his goals came in his last five matches. Suárez also led the league in assists, tied at 16 with Messi, becoming the first player ever to lead La Liga in both goals and assists.<sup id="cite_ref-Goal.com_17-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Goal.com-17">&#91;16&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Luis_Suarez_Player_Profile_18-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Luis_Suarez_Player_Profile-18">&#91;17&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 22 May, Suárez suffered a <a href="/wiki/Pulled_hamstring" title="Pulled hamstring">right hamstring</a> injury during Barcelona's 20 victory over Sevilla in the <a href="/wiki/2016_Copa_del_Rey_Final" title="2016 Copa del Rey Final">2016 Copa del Rey Final</a>. The club confirmed after the match that he would likely miss at least part of the upcoming <a href="/wiki/Copa_Am%C3%A9rica_Centenario" title="Copa América Centenario">Copa América Centenario</a> with <a href="/wiki/Uruguay_national_football_team" title="Uruguay national football team">his national team</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-hamstring_injury_194-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-hamstring_injury-194">&#91;191&#93;</a></sup> For Uruguay, Suárez also previously missed part of the 2014 World Cup and the entire 2015 Copa América through suspension.<sup id="cite_ref-Suárez_set_to_miss_start_of_Copa_América_195-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Suárez_set_to_miss_start_of_Copa_América-195">&#91;192&#93;</a></sup> The front three of Messi, Suárez and Neymar finished the season with 131 goals, breaking the record they had set the previous year for most goals by an attacking trio in a single season.<sup id="cite_ref-196" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-196">&#91;193&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Suárez opened <a href="/wiki/2016%E2%80%9317_FC_Barcelona_season" title="201617 FC Barcelona season">the following campaign</a> by scoring a goal in Barcelona's <a href="/wiki/2016_Supercopa_de_Espa%C3%B1a" title="2016 Supercopa de España">2016 Supercopa de España</a> first leg match against Sevilla as they recorded a 20 away victory. In the first match of the <a href="/wiki/2016%E2%80%9317_La_Liga" title="201617 La Liga">201617 La Liga</a> season, Suárez scored a hat-trick in a 62 victory against <a href="/wiki/Real_Betis" title="Real Betis">Real Betis</a>, also claiming his first free kick goal for Barcelona.<sup id="cite_ref-197" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-197">&#91;194&#93;</a></sup> Suárez made his 100th Barcelona appearance in a 12 defeat at home to <a href="/wiki/Deportivo_Alav%C3%A9s" title="Deportivo Alavés">Alavés</a>. Though unable to score, Suárez still claimed the distinction of having more goals and assists in his first 100 matches in Spain than both Cristiano Ronaldo and Messi; Suárez contributed 88 goals and 43 assists in his first 100 matches for Barcelona, compared to Ronaldo's 95 goals and 29 assists, and Messi's 41 goals and 14 assists.<sup id="cite_ref-198" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-198">&#91;195&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Suárez opened his <a href="/wiki/2016%E2%80%9317_UEFA_Champions_League" title="201617 UEFA Champions League">Champions League</a> account for the season with two goals in a 70 win defeat of <a href="/wiki/Celtic_F.C." title="Celtic F.C.">Celtic</a> on 13 September;<sup id="cite_ref-199" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-199">&#91;196&#93;</a></sup> this was followed by another goal three days later in a 51 La Liga win at <a href="/wiki/CD_Legan%C3%A9s" title="CD Leganés">Leganés</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-200" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-200">&#91;197&#93;</a></sup> On 11 January 2017, Suárez scored his 100th goal for Barcelona in a <a href="/wiki/2016%E2%80%9317_Copa_del_Rey" title="201617 Copa del Rey">Copa del Rey</a> round of 16 match against <a href="/wiki/Athletic_Bilbao" title="Athletic Bilbao">Athletic Bilbao</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-201" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-201">&#91;198&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 7 February, Suárez scored and was later sent off for a second yellow in Barcelona's semi-final match of the Copa del Rey against Atlético Madrid for an alleged foul on <a href="/wiki/Koke_(footballer,_born_1992)" title="Koke (footballer, born 1992)">Koke</a>, his first red card competitively for the club, meaning he would miss the <a href="/wiki/2017_Copa_del_Rey_Final" title="2017 Copa del Rey Final">final</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-202" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-202">&#91;199&#93;</a></sup> In an interview after the match, Suárez expressed his disdain with the referee's decision, and his desire for the club to appeal it.<sup id="cite_ref-203" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-203">&#91;200&#93;</a></sup> Barcelona would go on to win the final despite Suárez's absence, lifting the cup for a third straight season.<sup id="cite_ref-204" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-204">&#91;201&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 8 March, Suárez opened the scoring with a third minute header in Barcelona's famous <a href="/wiki/Barcelona_6%E2%80%931_Paris_Saint-Germain" class="mw-redirect" title="Barcelona 61 Paris Saint-Germain">61 victory</a> over Paris Saint-Germain in the <a href="/wiki/2016%E2%80%9317_UEFA_Champions_League_knockout_phase#Round_of_16" title="201617 UEFA Champions League knockout phase">Champions League round of 16</a> second leg, also later winning a penalty which Neymar converted for his side's fifth goal.<sup id="cite_ref-205" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-205">&#91;202&#93;</a></sup> Barcelona won 65 over PSG on aggregate, overcoming a 04 deficit suffered in the first leg, and achieved the biggest second leg comeback in UEFA Champions League history.<sup id="cite_ref-telegraph_206-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-telegraph-206">&#91;203&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span id="2017.E2.80.9319:_Back-to-back_La_Liga_triumphs"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="201719:_Back-to-back_La_Liga_triumphs">201719: Back-to-back La Liga triumphs</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Luis_Su%C3%A1rez&amp;action=edit&amp;section=20" title="Edit section: 201719: Back-to-back La Liga triumphs">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h4>
<p>On 23 September 2017, Suárez scored in Barcelona's 30 win over <a href="/wiki/Girona_FC" title="Girona FC">Girona</a>, in the first ever Catalan derby for the opposition.<sup id="cite_ref-207" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-207">&#91;204&#93;</a></sup> On 14 October, Suárez maintained Barcelona's undefeated start to the La Liga season with a late header against <a href="/wiki/Atl%C3%A9tico_Madrid" title="Atlético Madrid">Atlético Madrid</a> at the <a href="/wiki/Metropolitano_Stadium" title="Metropolitano Stadium">Metropolitano Stadium</a> in Madrid.<sup id="cite_ref-208" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-208">&#91;205&#93;</a></sup> He scored twice against <a href="/wiki/CD_Legan%C3%A9s" title="CD Leganés">Leganés</a> in a 30 win at the <a href="/wiki/Estadio_Municipal_de_Butarque" title="Estadio Municipal de Butarque">Estadio Municipal de Butarque</a> on 18 November.<sup id="cite_ref-209" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-209">&#91;206&#93;</a></sup> On 17 December, Suárez scored two against Deportivo La Coruña in a 40 win.<sup id="cite_ref-210" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-210">&#91;207&#93;</a></sup> Less than a week later, he opened the scoring for Barcelona in a 30 win over Real Madrid at the Bernabéu.<sup id="cite_ref-211" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-211">&#91;208&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Following the midseason break, Suárez scored twice in a 42 comeback win at <a href="/wiki/Real_Sociedad" title="Real Sociedad">Real Sociedad</a> on 14 January 2018.<sup id="cite_ref-212" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-212">&#91;209&#93;</a></sup> He scored a hat-trick in a 61 home win over Girona on 24 February.<sup id="cite_ref-213" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-213">&#91;210&#93;</a></sup> On 31 March, late goals from Suárez and Messi secured a 22 draw against Sevilla at the Ramón Sánchez Pizjuán.<sup id="cite_ref-214" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-214">&#91;211&#93;</a></sup> On 14 April, Suárez scored as Barcelona defeated Valencia 21 to secure the <a href="/wiki/Football_records_in_Spain#Games_without_a_loss" class="mw-redirect" title="Football records in Spain">longest unbeaten streak</a> in La Liga history, at 39 games.<sup id="cite_ref-215" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-215">&#91;212&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:152px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Luis_Suarez_2019_03_17_1.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f5/Luis_Suarez_2019_03_17_1.jpg/150px-Luis_Suarez_2019_03_17_1.jpg" decoding="async" width="150" height="187" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f5/Luis_Suarez_2019_03_17_1.jpg/225px-Luis_Suarez_2019_03_17_1.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f5/Luis_Suarez_2019_03_17_1.jpg/300px-Luis_Suarez_2019_03_17_1.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1396" data-file-height="1740" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Luis_Suarez_2019_03_17_1.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Suárez playing for Barcelona in 2019</div></div></div>
<p>On 21 April, Barcelona won their fourth consecutive Copa del Rey title, beating Sevilla 50 in the <a href="/wiki/2018_Copa_del_Rey_Final" title="2018 Copa del Rey Final">final</a> in Madrid, with Suárez scoring twice.<sup id="cite_ref-216" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-216">&#91;213&#93;</a></sup> Barcelona held on for a dramatic 22 draw at home to Real Madrid on 6 May, to extend their unbeaten streak in the league; Suárez and Messi scored the goals for Barça.<sup id="cite_ref-217" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-217">&#91;214&#93;</a></sup> Barcelona's record league unbeaten streak came to an end after 43 games, following a 45 loss to Levante in the penultimate game of the season on 13 May. Barcelona mounted a comeback after trailing 15, with Suárez scoring one and new club record signing <a href="/wiki/Philippe_Coutinho" title="Philippe Coutinho">Philippe Coutinho</a> scoring a hat-trick, but they couldn't find an equalizer.<sup id="cite_ref-218" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-218">&#91;215&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Following the beginning of the new season, Suárez scored twice for Barcelona in an 82 win over newly promoted <a href="/wiki/SD_Huesca" title="SD Huesca">Huesca</a> on 2 September 2018.<sup id="cite_ref-219" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-219">&#91;216&#93;</a></sup> A week later he scored in their 21 victory at Real Sociedad, as the club made it four wins out of four in La Liga.<sup id="cite_ref-220" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-220">&#91;217&#93;</a></sup> On 28 October, Suárez scored a hat-trick in a 51 home win over Real Madrid in <i><a href="/wiki/El_Cl%C3%A1sico" title="El Clásico">El Clásico</a></i>.<sup id="cite_ref-221" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-221">&#91;218&#93;</a></sup> He became only the second Barcelona player after Messi to score a league hat-trick in the <i>Clásico</i> over the last twenty years.<sup id="cite_ref-222" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-222">&#91;219&#93;</a></sup> 
</p><p>On 27 April 2019, Barcelona secured a second consecutive <a href="/wiki/2018%E2%80%9319_La_Liga" title="201819 La Liga">La Liga title</a>, and Suárez's fourth league title with the club.<sup id="cite_ref-223" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-223">&#91;220&#93;</a></sup> However, Suárez scored only one goal in the <a href="/wiki/2018%E2%80%9319_UEFA_Champions_League" title="201819 UEFA Champions League">201819 UEFA Champions League</a>; this came on 1 May, as he netted Barcelona's opener in their 30 win over Suárez's former club Liverpool in the first leg of the semi-finals.<sup id="cite_ref-224" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-224">&#91;221&#93;</a></sup> However, Barcelona would go on to lose the second leg 04 at <a href="/wiki/Anfield" title="Anfield">Anfield</a> on 7 May, being eliminated and squandering a three-goal first leg lead in the competiton for the second consecutive season.<sup id="cite_ref-225" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-225">&#91;222&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span id="2019.E2.80.9320:_Final_season"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="201920:_Final_season">201920: Final season</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Luis_Su%C3%A1rez&amp;action=edit&amp;section=21" title="Edit section: 201920: Final season">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h4>
<p>On 15 September, after coming off of a calf injury that he suffered during the first game of the <a href="/wiki/2019%E2%80%9320_La_Liga" title="201920 La Liga">201920 league campaign</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-226" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-226">&#91;223&#93;</a></sup> Suárez opened his scoring account by netting a brace in a 52 victory over Valencia as a 60th minute substitute.<sup id="cite_ref-227" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-227">&#91;224&#93;</a></sup> On 2 October, he scored two goals in a 21 comeback win over <a href="/wiki/Inter_Milan" title="Inter Milan">Inter Milan</a> in the <a href="/wiki/2019%E2%80%9320_UEFA_Champions_League_group_stage" title="201920 UEFA Champions League group stage">201920 UEFA Champions League group stage</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-228" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-228">&#91;225&#93;</a></sup> Four days later, he opened the scoring in a 40 league victory over Sevilla with a <a href="/wiki/Bicycle_kick" title="Bicycle kick">bicycle kick</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-229" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-229">&#91;226&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 27 November, Suárez opened the scoring in a 31 win over <a href="/wiki/Borussia_Dortmund" title="Borussia Dortmund">Borussia Dortmund</a> in the Champions League group stage, before setting up Messi for the second goal.<sup id="cite_ref-230" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-230">&#91;227&#93;</a></sup> On 7 December, he scored a curving backheel goal in a 52 victory over <a href="/wiki/RCD_Mallorca" title="RCD Mallorca">Mallorca</a>, being lauded by many as one of the goals of the season.<sup id="cite_ref-231" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-231">&#91;228&#93;</a></sup> Three days later, Suárez captained Barcelona for the first time as he came off of the bench to set up <a href="/wiki/Ansu_Fati" title="Ansu Fati">Ansu Fati</a>'s late goal in a 21 win over Inter during the final match of Barcelona's Champions League group. On 12 January 2020, Barcelona confirmed that Suárez would have to undergo a surgery which could see him out for four months, after catching a knee injury during their defeat against Atlético Madrid in the <a href="/wiki/2019%E2%80%9320_Supercopa_de_Espa%C3%B1a" title="201920 Supercopa de España">Supercopa de España</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-232" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-232">&#91;229&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 9 July, by scoring the only goal in a 1-0 win over <a href="/wiki/RCD_Espanyol" title="RCD Espanyol">Espanyol</a>, Suárez took his tally to 195 goals with Barcelona, surpassing <a href="/wiki/L%C3%A1szl%C3%B3_Kubala" title="László Kubala">László Kubala</a> to become the third all-time top goalscorer in the club's history.<sup id="cite_ref-233" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-233">&#91;230&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 8 August, having missed the first leg due to injury, Suárez scored from the <a href="/wiki/Penalty_kick" class="mw-redirect" title="Penalty kick">penalty spot</a> during Barcelona's 31 win over <a href="/wiki/S.S.C._Napoli" title="S.S.C. Napoli">Napoli</a> in the second leg of their Champions League round of 16 tie, as they advanced to the quarter-finals to play <a href="/wiki/FC_Bayern_Munich" title="FC Bayern Munich">Bayern Munich</a> in a single-legged match. On 14 August, Suárez scored his side's second goal as Barcelona suffered a historic <a href="/wiki/FC_Barcelona_2%E2%80%938_FC_Bayern_Munich" title="FC Barcelona 28 FC Bayern Munich">28 defeat against Bayern</a>, the club's worst defeat in nearly seventy years and capping a first trophyless season since <a href="/wiki/2007%E2%80%9308_FC_Barcelona_season" title="200708 FC Barcelona season">200708</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-234" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-234">&#91;231&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-235" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-235">&#91;232&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span id="Atl.C3.A9tico_Madrid"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="Atlético_Madrid">Atlético Madrid</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Luis_Su%C3%A1rez&amp;action=edit&amp;section=22" title="Edit section: Atlético Madrid">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span id="2020.E2.80.9321_season"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="202021_season">202021 season</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Luis_Su%C3%A1rez&amp;action=edit&amp;section=23" title="Edit section: 202021 season">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h4>
<div class="quotebox pullquote floatright" style="width:27%; ;"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1012376600"/>
<div class="quotebox-quote left-aligned" style="">"You deserved a farewell befitting who you are: one of the most important players in the history of the club, achieving great things for the team and on an individual level. You did not deserve for them to throw you out like they did. But the truth is that at this stage nothing surprises me any more."</div>
<p><cite class="left-aligned" style=""> Former team-mate <a href="/wiki/Lionel_Messi" title="Lionel Messi">Lionel Messi</a> slams Barcelona for the manner of Suárezs departure.<sup id="cite_ref-Barca_departure_236-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Barca_departure-236">&#91;233&#93;</a></sup></cite>
</p>
</div>
<p>After becoming Barcelona head coach on 19 August 2020, <a href="/wiki/Ronald_Koeman" title="Ronald Koeman">Ronald Koeman</a> informed Suárez he was no longer wanted, and club president <a href="/wiki/Josep_Maria_Bartomeu" title="Josep Maria Bartomeu">Josep Maria Bartomeu</a> had also left him off a list of players he considered not for sale in the aftermath of the 82 defeat to Bayern Munich in the Champions League earlier that month.<sup id="cite_ref-Barca_departure_236-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Barca_departure-236">&#91;233&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 23 September 2020, after failing to join <a href="/wiki/Juventus_F.C." title="Juventus F.C.">Juventus</a> and amid accusations that he cheated his way to obtain an Italian citizenship,<sup id="cite_ref-237" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-237">&#91;234&#93;</a></sup> Suárez signed a two-year contract with <a href="/wiki/Atl%C3%A9tico_Madrid" title="Atlético Madrid">Atlético Madrid</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-238" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-238">&#91;235&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-239" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-239">&#91;236&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 27 September, Suárez made his debut for the club, scoring two goals and providing <a href="/wiki/Marcos_Llorente" title="Marcos Llorente">Marcos Llorente</a> with an assist in a 61 victory against <a href="/wiki/Granada_CF" title="Granada CF">Granada</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-240" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-240">&#91;237&#93;</a></sup> On 25 November, Suárez's backheel goal against Mallorca, which he scored on 7 December 2019, was nominated for the <a href="/wiki/The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2020#FIFA_Puskás_Award" title="The Best FIFA Football Awards 2020">2020 FIFA Puskás Award</a>, eventually finishing in second behind a goal scored by <a href="/wiki/Tottenham_Hotspur_F.C." title="Tottenham Hotspur F.C.">Tottenham Hotspur</a>'s <a href="/wiki/Son_Heung-min" title="Son Heung-min">Son Heung-min</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-241" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-241">&#91;238&#93;</a></sup> On 3 January 2021, Suárez scored a 90th minute winner against <a href="/wiki/Deportivo_Alav%C3%A9s" title="Deportivo Alavés">Alavés</a>, a feat which saw him overtake <a href="/wiki/Radamel_Falcao" title="Radamel Falcao">Radamel Falcao</a>'s record for a player's best start with Atlético this century; his eleven goals contributions (nine goals and two assists) in his first twelve La Liga matches surpassed Falcao's nine goals and one assist over the same period in 2011.<sup id="cite_ref-242" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-242">&#91;239&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 21 January, Suárez scored a brace, including a last-minute penalty, in a 21 win over <a href="/wiki/SD_Eibar" title="SD Eibar">Eibar</a>. This meant that he had managed to hit double figures in goals in each of his past ten league campaigns.<sup id="cite_ref-243" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-243">&#91;240&#93;</a></sup> Three days later, he scored Atlético's second goal in a 31 comeback victory over <a href="/wiki/Valencia_CF" title="Valencia CF">Valencia</a>, taking his league tally to twelve goals in fifteen games, the joint-most in La Liga. This feat meant Suárez had accomplished the best start for a player at a new club in the league since <a href="/wiki/Cristiano_Ronaldo" title="Cristiano Ronaldo">Cristiano Ronaldo</a>'s move to <a href="/wiki/Real_Madrid_CF" title="Real Madrid CF">Real Madrid</a> (thirteen goals in fifteen appearances in 2010).<sup id="cite_ref-244" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-244">&#91;241&#93;</a></sup> On 31 January, Suárez scored another two goals in a 42 victory over <a href="/wiki/C%C3%A1diz_CF" title="Cádiz CF">Cádiz</a>, also netting his first free kick goal for the club.<sup id="cite_ref-245" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-245">&#91;242&#93;</a></sup> He then scored an additional brace on 8 February, in Atlético's 22 draw against <a href="/wiki/RC_Celta_de_Vigo" title="RC Celta de Vigo">Celta Vigo</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-246" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-246">&#91;243&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 7 March, Suárez scored the opener against Real Madrid in the <a href="/wiki/Madrid_Derby" title="Madrid Derby">Madrid Derby</a>, his first goal in five matches, though Atlético conceded late as the match ended in a 11 draw.<sup id="cite_ref-247" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-247">&#91;244&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 17 march, Suárez scored his first hat-trick for Atletico Madrid in the second leg of UEFA Champions League round of 16 tie as they went on to win 3-2 on aggregate against Chelsea.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="International_career">International career</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Luis_Su%C3%A1rez&amp;action=edit&amp;section=24" title="Edit section: International career">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<p>Suárez was invited to play for <a href="/wiki/Uruguay_national_under-20_football_team" title="Uruguay national under-20 football team">Uruguay</a> in the qualifying rounds for the <a href="/wiki/2007_FIFA_U-20_World_Cup" title="2007 FIFA U-20 World Cup">2007 U-20 World Cup</a>, but his club, Groningen, did not release him to play.<sup id="cite_ref-9_Suarez_profile_248-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-9_Suarez_profile-248">&#91;245&#93;</a></sup> He did play in the tournament finals, and he scored two goals in four appearances.<sup id="cite_ref-FIFA_stats_249-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FIFA_stats-249">&#91;246&#93;</a></sup> His goals came in a group stage draw against <a href="/wiki/Spain_national_under-20_football_team" title="Spain national under-20 football team">Spain</a><sup id="cite_ref-Bell_250-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Bell-250">&#91;247&#93;</a></sup> and in the <a href="/wiki/2007_FIFA_U-20_World_Cup#Round_of_16" title="2007 FIFA U-20 World Cup">Round of 16</a> against the <a href="/wiki/United_States_national_under-20_football_team" class="mw-redirect" title="United States national under-20 football team">United States</a>, but the U.S. won 21 and Uruguay was eliminated from the tournament.<sup id="cite_ref-251" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-251">&#91;248&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Suárez made his senior debut for <a href="/wiki/Uruguay_national_football_team" title="Uruguay national football team">Uruguay</a> on 8 February 2007 in a 31 win against <a href="/wiki/Colombia_national_football_team" title="Colombia national football team">Colombia</a>. He was <a href="/wiki/Misconduct_(association_football)" class="mw-redirect" title="Misconduct (association football)">sent off</a> in the 85th minute after receiving a second yellow card for dissent.<sup id="cite_ref-Pearce_1-3_40-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Pearce_1-3-40">&#91;37&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-9_Suarez_profile_248-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-9_Suarez_profile-248">&#91;245&#93;</a></sup> Suárez played in 19 of 20 games in <a href="/wiki/2010_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_(CONMEBOL)" title="2010 FIFA World Cup qualification (CONMEBOL)">2010 World Cup qualifying</a> and the
<a href="/wiki/2010_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_(inter-confederation_play-offs)#CONCACAF_v_CONMEBOL" title="2010 FIFA World Cup qualification (inter-confederation play-offs)">inter-confederation play-offs</a> and scored five goals.<sup id="cite_ref-FIFA_stats_249-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FIFA_stats-249">&#91;246&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="2010_FIFA_World_Cup">2010 FIFA World Cup</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Luis_Su%C3%A1rez&amp;action=edit&amp;section=25" title="Edit section: 2010 FIFA World Cup">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Su%C3%A1rez_Forlan.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c7/Su%C3%A1rez_Forlan.jpg/170px-Su%C3%A1rez_Forlan.jpg" decoding="async" width="170" height="268" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c7/Su%C3%A1rez_Forlan.jpg/255px-Su%C3%A1rez_Forlan.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c7/Su%C3%A1rez_Forlan.jpg/340px-Su%C3%A1rez_Forlan.jpg 2x" data-file-width="378" data-file-height="595" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Su%C3%A1rez_Forlan.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Suárez (left) and <a href="/wiki/Diego_Forl%C3%A1n" title="Diego Forlán">Diego Forlán</a> at the <a href="/wiki/2010_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2010 FIFA World Cup">2010 FIFA World Cup</a> in South Africa</div></div></div>
<p>In June 2010, <a href="/wiki/%C3%93scar_Tab%C3%A1rez" title="Óscar Tabárez">Óscar Tabárez</a> named Suárez to Uruguay's 23-man <a href="/wiki/2010_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2010 FIFA World Cup">World Cup</a> squad.<sup id="cite_ref-252" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-252">&#91;249&#93;</a></sup> Uruguay began the tournament with a 00 draw against <a href="/wiki/France_national_football_team" title="France national football team">France</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-253" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-253">&#91;250&#93;</a></sup> In the second match, a 30 win over <a href="/wiki/South_Africa_national_football_team" title="South Africa national football team">South Africa</a>, Suárez drew a penalty and assisted <a href="/wiki/%C3%81lvaro_Pereira" title="Álvaro Pereira">Álvaro Pereira</a>'s <a href="/wiki/Stoppage_time#Duration_and_tie-breaking_methods" class="mw-redirect" title="Stoppage time">stoppage time</a> goal.<sup id="cite_ref-254" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-254">&#91;251&#93;</a></sup> In the final match of the group stage, he headed in a goal off a pass from <a href="/wiki/Edinson_Cavani" title="Edinson Cavani">Edinson Cavani</a> and was named <a href="/wiki/Man_of_the_Match" class="mw-redirect" title="Man of the Match">Man of the Match</a> in a 10 win over <a href="/wiki/Mexico_national_football_team" title="Mexico national football team">Mexico</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-FIFA_Uru-Mex_255-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FIFA_Uru-Mex-255">&#91;252&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Hassan_256-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Hassan-256">&#91;253&#93;</a></sup> Uruguay won <a href="/wiki/2010_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_A" title="2010 FIFA World Cup Group A">Group A</a> and advanced to the <a href="/wiki/Single-elimination_tournament" title="Single-elimination tournament">knockout stage</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-FIFA_Uru-Mex_255-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FIFA_Uru-Mex-255">&#91;252&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Hassan_256-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Hassan-256">&#91;253&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>During the <a href="/wiki/2010_FIFA_World_Cup_knockout_stage#Round_of_16" title="2010 FIFA World Cup knockout stage">round of 16</a> against <a href="/wiki/South_Korea_national_football_team" title="South Korea national football team">South Korea</a>, Suárez scored both goals in a 21 win. His second broke a tie in the 80th minute when he dribbled around a defender and curled a "spectacular shot"<sup id="cite_ref-FIFA_Uru-Kor_257-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FIFA_Uru-Kor-257">&#91;254&#93;</a></sup> in off the far post; Suárez was again named Man of the Match.<sup id="cite_ref-FIFA_Uru-Kor_257-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FIFA_Uru-Kor-257">&#91;254&#93;</a></sup> This win put Uruguay through to the quarter-finals for the first time since <a href="/wiki/1970_FIFA_World_Cup" title="1970 FIFA World Cup">1970</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-258" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-258">&#91;255&#93;</a></sup> In the <a href="/wiki/Uruguay_v_Ghana_(2010)" class="mw-redirect" title="Uruguay v Ghana (2010)">quarter-final</a> against <a href="/wiki/Ghana_national_football_team" title="Ghana national football team">Ghana</a>, the score was 11 at the end of regulation and the match went into <a href="/wiki/Extra_time#Association_football" class="mw-redirect" title="Extra time">extra time</a>. Late in extra time, Ghana sent a <a href="/wiki/Direct_free_kick" class="mw-redirect" title="Direct free kick">free-kick</a> into the box, and Suárez blocked <a href="/wiki/Stephen_Appiah" title="Stephen Appiah">Stephen Appiah</a>'s shot on the goal line.<sup id="cite_ref-FIFA_Uru-Gha_259-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FIFA_Uru-Gha-259">&#91;256&#93;</a></sup> He then blocked <a href="/wiki/Dominic_Adiyiah" title="Dominic Adiyiah">Dominic Adiyiah</a>'s goalbound header with his hands, committing a <a href="/wiki/Professional_foul#Association_football" title="Professional foul">professional foul</a><sup id="cite_ref-Echo_2-3_70-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Echo_2-3-70">&#91;67&#93;</a></sup> to save what would have been the game winner<sup id="cite_ref-Hand_of_God_260-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Hand_of_God-260">&#91;257&#93;</a></sup> and was sent off. <a href="/wiki/Asamoah_Gyan" title="Asamoah Gyan">Asamoah Gyan</a> hit the crossbar with the ensuing <a href="/wiki/Penalty_kick_(association_football)" title="Penalty kick (association football)">penalty kick</a><sup id="cite_ref-FIFA_Uru-Gha_259-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FIFA_Uru-Gha-259">&#91;256&#93;</a></sup> and Suárez, who had stopped to watch, celebrated the miss before heading down the tunnel.<sup id="cite_ref-Marcus_261-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Marcus-261">&#91;258&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-reuters_262-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-reuters-262">&#91;259&#93;</a></sup> Uruguay won the <a href="/wiki/Penalty_shoot-out_(association_football)" title="Penalty shoot-out (association football)">shootout</a> 42 and advanced to the semi-finals.<sup id="cite_ref-FIFA_Uru-Gha_259-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FIFA_Uru-Gha-259">&#91;256&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-263" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-263">&#91;260&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="quotebox pullquote floatleft" style="width:27%; ;"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1012376600"/>
<div class="quotebox-quote left-aligned" style="">"The Hand of God now belongs to me. Mine is the real Hand of God."</div>
<p><cite class="left-aligned" style="">After using his hand in the quarter-final against Ghana, Suárez referred to <a href="/wiki/Diego_Maradona" title="Diego Maradona">Diego Maradona</a>'s <a href="/wiki/Argentina_v_England_(1986_FIFA_World_Cup)#The_&quot;Hand_of_God&quot;" title="Argentina v England (1986 FIFA World Cup)">Hand of God goal against England</a> in <a href="/wiki/1986_FIFA_World_Cup" title="1986 FIFA World Cup">1986</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-264" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-264">&#91;261&#93;</a></sup></cite>
</p>
</div>
<p>After the match, Suárez said, "I made the save of the tournament."<sup id="cite_ref-Hand_of_God_260-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Hand_of_God-260">&#91;257&#93;</a></sup> He said he had no alternative, was acting out of instinct, and would do it again if it helped his team win.<sup id="cite_ref-Doward_265-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Doward-265">&#91;262&#93;</a></sup> Ghana head coach <a href="/wiki/Milovan_Rajevac" title="Milovan Rajevac">Milovan Rajevac</a> said the play was an "injustice"<sup id="cite_ref-Marcus_261-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Marcus-261">&#91;258&#93;</a></sup> and Suárez was labelled a villain and a cheater.<sup id="cite_ref-Jim_White_266-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Jim_White-266">&#91;263&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Doward_265-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Doward-265">&#91;262&#93;</a></sup> Others viewed him as a hero.<sup id="cite_ref-Echo_2-3_70-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Echo_2-3-70">&#91;67&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-267" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-267">&#91;264&#93;</a></sup> Due to the automatic suspension that accompanies a red card, Suárez sacrificed himself in the semi-final for the unlikely chance the penalty would be missed, and his team would later win.<sup id="cite_ref-Lyttleton_41-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Lyttleton-41">&#91;38&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Jim_White_266-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Jim_White-266">&#91;263&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>While Suárez was suspended for the <a href="/wiki/2010_FIFA_World_Cup_knockout_stage#Uruguay_vs_Netherlands" title="2010 FIFA World Cup knockout stage">semi-final</a> match for his red card against Ghana,<sup id="cite_ref-268" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-268">&#91;265&#93;</a></sup> Uruguay "lacked a second striker [alongside <a href="/wiki/Diego_Forl%C3%A1n" title="Diego Forlán">Diego Forlán</a>] of cunning and movement"<sup id="cite_ref-269" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-269">&#91;266&#93;</a></sup> and lost 32 to the <a href="/wiki/Netherlands_national_football_team" title="Netherlands national football team">Netherlands</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-270" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-270">&#91;267&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-271" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-271">&#91;268&#93;</a></sup> Suárez returned for the <a href="/wiki/2010_FIFA_World_Cup_knockout_stage#Third_place_play-off" title="2010 FIFA World Cup knockout stage">third place game</a> against <a href="/wiki/Germany_national_football_team" title="Germany national football team">Germany</a>; he was booed almost every time he had the ball because of his handball in the Ghana match.<sup id="cite_ref-CNN_3rd_place_game_272-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-CNN_3rd_place_game-272">&#91;269&#93;</a></sup> He assisted Cavani on Uruguay's first goal,<sup id="cite_ref-273" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-273">&#91;270&#93;</a></sup> but Uruguay lost 32.<sup id="cite_ref-CNN_3rd_place_game_272-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-CNN_3rd_place_game-272">&#91;269&#93;</a></sup> During the tournament, Suárez played 543 minutes in six appearances and scored three goals.<sup id="cite_ref-9_Suarez_overview_274-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-9_Suarez_overview-274">&#91;271&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span id="2011_Copa_Am.C3.A9rica"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="2011_Copa_América">2011 Copa América</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Luis_Su%C3%A1rez&amp;action=edit&amp;section=26" title="Edit section: 2011 Copa América">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Luis_Suarez_-_CA2011_mvp_award_(cropped).jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1e/Luis_Suarez_-_CA2011_mvp_award_%28cropped%29.jpg/170px-Luis_Suarez_-_CA2011_mvp_award_%28cropped%29.jpg" decoding="async" width="170" height="304" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1e/Luis_Suarez_-_CA2011_mvp_award_%28cropped%29.jpg/255px-Luis_Suarez_-_CA2011_mvp_award_%28cropped%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1e/Luis_Suarez_-_CA2011_mvp_award_%28cropped%29.jpg/340px-Luis_Suarez_-_CA2011_mvp_award_%28cropped%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="488" data-file-height="872" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Luis_Suarez_-_CA2011_mvp_award_(cropped).jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Suárez was named most valuable player of the <a href="/wiki/2011_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica" title="2011 Copa América">2011 Copa América</a></div></div></div>
<p>In the <a href="/wiki/2011_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica" title="2011 Copa América">2011 Copa América</a>, Suárez scored in Uruguay's opening game, a 11 draw with <a href="/wiki/Peru_national_football_team" title="Peru national football team">Peru</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-275" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-275">&#91;272&#93;</a></sup> In their next game, he provided the assist for Alvaro Pereira's goal in a 1-1 draw with <a href="/wiki/Chile_national_football_team" title="Chile national football team">Chile</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-276" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-276">&#91;273&#93;</a></sup> Uruguay finished second in their group and advanced to the knockout round<sup id="cite_ref-277" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-277">&#91;274&#93;</a></sup> with a win, 10 against Mexico, and two draws, against Peru and Chile.<sup id="cite_ref-278" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-278">&#91;275&#93;</a></sup> In the quarter-finals, Uruguay drew with tournament hosts <a href="/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team" title="Argentina national football team">Argentina</a> 11 after regulation and extra time. Uruguay won the shootout 54 and Suárez converted his penalty.<sup id="cite_ref-279" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-279">&#91;276&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-280" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-280">&#91;277&#93;</a></sup> Suárez scored both goals in Uruguay's 20 semi-final win over Peru and was named Man of the Match.<sup id="cite_ref-281" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-281">&#91;278&#93;</a></sup> In <a href="/wiki/2011_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica_Final" title="2011 Copa América Final">the final</a>, Suárez scored the opening goal and set up Diego Forlan's second goal as Uruguay defeated <a href="/wiki/Paraguay_national_football_team" title="Paraguay national football team">Paraguay</a> 30 for their record 15th Copa América title.<sup id="cite_ref-CopaAmerica_282-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-CopaAmerica-282">&#91;279&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-283" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-283">&#91;280&#93;</a></sup> Suárez scored four goals and provided two assists during the tournament and was named MVP of the Tournament.<sup id="cite_ref-CopaAmerica_282-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-CopaAmerica-282">&#91;279&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Liverpool_profile_57-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Liverpool_profile-57">&#91;54&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-284" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-284">&#91;281&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="2012_Summer_Olympics">2012 Summer Olympics</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Luis_Su%C3%A1rez&amp;action=edit&amp;section=27" title="Edit section: 2012 Summer Olympics">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<p>On 9 July 2012, Suárez was selected for the <a href="/wiki/Uruguay_Olympic_football_team" title="Uruguay Olympic football team">Uruguay Olympic football team</a> alongside Liverpool teammate <a href="/wiki/Sebasti%C3%A1n_Coates" title="Sebastián Coates">Sebastián Coates</a> to compete in the <a href="/wiki/Football_at_the_2012_Summer_Olympics_%E2%80%93_Men%27s_tournament" title="Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics  Men&#39;s tournament">2012 Olympic Games</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Olympic_Games_285-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Olympic_Games-285">&#91;282&#93;</a></sup> In the first pre-tournament warm-up game against Chile on 11 July, Suárez scored a hat-trick for Uruguay as they came from 02 down to win 64 in a thrilling match.<sup id="cite_ref-286" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-286">&#91;283&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>As one of Uruguay's three overage players, Suárez was named as captain for the Olympic Games.<sup id="cite_ref-287" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-287">&#91;284&#93;</a></sup> After an opening win over the <a href="/wiki/United_Arab_Emirates_national_under-23_football_team" title="United Arab Emirates national under-23 football team">United Arab Emirates</a>, Uruguay were defeated by <a href="/wiki/Senegal_national_under-23_football_team" title="Senegal national under-23 football team">Senegal</a> and <a href="/wiki/Great_Britain_Olympic_football_team" title="Great Britain Olympic football team">Great Britain</a> and eliminated at the first round. Suárez failed to score during the tournament.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="2013_Confederations_Cup">2013 Confederations Cup</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Luis_Su%C3%A1rez&amp;action=edit&amp;section=28" title="Edit section: 2013 Confederations Cup">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<p>Suárez was selected in the Uruguay squad to play in Brazil at the <a href="/wiki/2013_FIFA_Confederations_Cup" title="2013 FIFA Confederations Cup">2013 Confederations Cup</a>. He scored a curling free-kick from 30 yards (27&#160;m) in a 21 defeat to <a href="/wiki/Spain_national_football_team" title="Spain national football team">Spain</a> in their opening match at <a href="/wiki/Recife" title="Recife">Recife</a> on 16 June.<sup id="cite_ref-288" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-288">&#91;285&#93;</a></sup> He then scored twice after appearing as a substitute in Uruguay's 80 win over <a href="/wiki/Tahiti_national_football_team" title="Tahiti national football team">Tahiti</a>, making him the Uruguay national team's all-time <a href="/wiki/Uruguay_national_football_team#Records" title="Uruguay national football team">top-goalscorer</a> with 35 goals, surpassing his teammate Diego Forlán.<sup id="cite_ref-289" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-289">&#91;286&#93;</a></sup> Uruguay were eventually eliminated in the semi-finals, losing 21 to <a href="/wiki/Brazil_national_football_team" title="Brazil national football team">Brazil</a> in <a href="/wiki/Belo_Horizonte" title="Belo Horizonte">Belo Horizonte</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-290" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-290">&#91;287&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span id="2014_FIFA_World_Cup.2C_third_biting_incident"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="2014_FIFA_World_Cup,_third_biting_incident">2014 FIFA World Cup, third biting incident</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Luis_Su%C3%A1rez&amp;action=edit&amp;section=29" title="Edit section: 2014 FIFA World Cup, third biting incident">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:FIFA_World_Cup_2014_-_Uruguay_2_-_England_1_-_140619-6454-jikatu_(14282608880).jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2b/FIFA_World_Cup_2014_-_Uruguay_2_-_England_1_-_140619-6454-jikatu_%2814282608880%29.jpg/220px-FIFA_World_Cup_2014_-_Uruguay_2_-_England_1_-_140619-6454-jikatu_%2814282608880%29.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="147" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2b/FIFA_World_Cup_2014_-_Uruguay_2_-_England_1_-_140619-6454-jikatu_%2814282608880%29.jpg/330px-FIFA_World_Cup_2014_-_Uruguay_2_-_England_1_-_140619-6454-jikatu_%2814282608880%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2b/FIFA_World_Cup_2014_-_Uruguay_2_-_England_1_-_140619-6454-jikatu_%2814282608880%29.jpg/440px-FIFA_World_Cup_2014_-_Uruguay_2_-_England_1_-_140619-6454-jikatu_%2814282608880%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2048" data-file-height="1365" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:FIFA_World_Cup_2014_-_Uruguay_2_-_England_1_-_140619-6454-jikatu_(14282608880).jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Suárez (middle) <a href="/wiki/Goal_celebration" title="Goal celebration">celebrating</a> one of his two goals against <a href="/wiki/England_national_football_team" title="England national football team">England</a> at the 2014 World Cup</div></div></div>
<p>Suárez ended the <a href="/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification" title="2014 FIFA World Cup qualification">2014 World Cup qualification</a> campaign as <a href="/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_(CONMEBOL)#Goalscorers" title="2014 FIFA World Cup qualification (CONMEBOL)">top scorer</a> in the <a href="/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_(CONMEBOL)" title="2014 FIFA World Cup qualification (CONMEBOL)">South American section</a> with 11 goals in 14 matches.<sup id="cite_ref-291" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-291">&#91;288&#93;</a></sup> In November 2013, Uruguay defeated <a href="/wiki/Jordan_national_football_team" title="Jordan national football team">Jordan</a> 50 on aggregate in an <a href="/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_(AFC_%E2%80%93_CONMEBOL_play-off)" class="mw-redirect" title="2014 FIFA World Cup qualification (AFC  CONMEBOL play-off)">intercontinental play-off</a> to qualify for the <a href="/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2014 FIFA World Cup">2014 World Cup</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-292" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-292">&#91;289&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 22 May, Suárez underwent emergency surgery on his left knee. He was confined to a wheelchair for a time, leading to rumours he would be unable to participate in the World Cup.<sup id="cite_ref-293" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-293">&#91;290&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-294" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-294">&#91;291&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-295" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-295">&#91;292&#93;</a></sup> He was named as a substitute for Uruguay's first match, a 31 defeat to <a href="/wiki/Costa_Rica_national_football_team" title="Costa Rica national football team">Costa Rica</a>, but did not play in the match. Suárez started Uruguay's second match against <a href="/wiki/England_national_football_team" title="England national football team">England</a> and scored both of the team's goals in a 21 win at the <a href="/wiki/Arena_Corinthians" title="Arena Corinthians">Arena Corinthians</a> in <a href="/wiki/S%C3%A3o_Paulo" title="São Paulo">São Paulo</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-296" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-296">&#91;293&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="quotebox pullquote floatright" style="width:27%; ;"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1012376600"/>
<div class="quotebox-quote left-aligned" style="">"These are just things that happen out on the pitch. It was just the two of us inside the area and he bumped into me with his shoulder and that's how my eye got like this as well. There are things that happen on the pitch and you should not make such a big deal out of them."</div>
<p><cite class="left-aligned" style=""> Suárez's post-match interview against Italy, 24 June 2014.<sup id="cite_ref-297" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-297">&#91;294&#93;</a></sup></cite>
</p>
</div>
<div class="quotebox pullquote floatright" style="width:27%; ;"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1012376600"/>
<div class="quotebox-quote left-aligned" style="">"... I lost my balance ... falling on top of my opponent ... I hit my face against [Chiellini], leaving a small bruise on my cheek and a strong pain in my teeth."</div>
<p><cite class="left-aligned" style=""> Suárez's defence to the FIFA Disciplinary Committee, 25 June.<sup id="cite_ref-lostbalance_298-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-lostbalance-298">&#91;295&#93;</a></sup></cite>
</p>
</div>
<div class="quotebox pullquote floatright" style="width:27%; ;"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1012376600"/>
<div class="quotebox-quote left-aligned" style="">"... the truth is that my colleague Giorgio Chiellini suffered the physical result of a bite in the collision he suffered with me ... I apologize to Giorgio Chiellini and the entire football family. I vow to the public that there will never again be another incident like [this]."</div>
<p><cite class="left-aligned" style=""> Suárez on 30 June 2014.<sup id="cite_ref-Suarez_apology_Twitter_299-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Suarez_apology_Twitter-299">&#91;296&#93;</a></sup></cite>
</p>
</div>
<p>For Uruguay's final group match against <a href="/wiki/Italy_national_football_team" title="Italy national football team">Italy</a> on 24 June, Uruguay needed a win to advance to the <a href="/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup_knockout_stage" title="2014 FIFA World Cup knockout stage">knockout stage</a> while Italy only needed a draw.<sup id="cite_ref-300" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-300">&#91;297&#93;</a></sup> Around the 79th minute and with the score at 00, Suárez clashed with Italian defender <a href="/wiki/Giorgio_Chiellini" title="Giorgio Chiellini">Giorgio Chiellini</a> while waiting for a cross. Replays showed that Suárez lunged at Chiellini and bit his shoulder (Chiellini showed bite marks), followed by Suárez falling and clutching his face.<sup id="cite_ref-Menezes_301-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Menezes-301">&#91;298&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-bite_row_302-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-bite_row-302">&#91;299&#93;</a></sup> The controversial incident made headline news around the world.<sup id="cite_ref-303" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-303">&#91;300&#93;</a></sup> As the Italian players protested to Mexican referee <a href="/wiki/Marco_Antonio_Rodr%C3%ADguez" title="Marco Antonio Rodríguez">Marco Antonio Rodríguez</a> for not penalising Suárez for the bite, Uruguay won a corner and scored. The match would finish 10 to Uruguay as they qualified for the knockout stage and eliminated Italy.<sup id="cite_ref-Menezes_301-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Menezes-301">&#91;298&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-bite_row_302-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-bite_row-302">&#91;299&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-304" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-304">&#91;301&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Two days later, on 26 June, the <a href="/wiki/FIFA_Disciplinary_Code" title="FIFA Disciplinary Code">FIFA Disciplinary Committee</a>, banned Suárez for nine international matches, effective immediately, meaning he would take no further part in the World Cup. The ban ruled him out of <a href="/wiki/2015_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica" title="2015 Copa América">2015 Copa América</a> as well. It was the longest such ban in World Cup history, exceeding the eight-match ban handed to Italy's <a href="/wiki/Mauro_Tassotti" title="Mauro Tassotti">Mauro Tassotti</a> for breaking the nose of Spain's Luis Enrique at the <a href="/wiki/1994_FIFA_World_Cup" title="1994 FIFA World Cup">1994 World Cup</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Ban2014_160-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Ban2014-160">&#91;157&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Luis_Suarez_suspended_305-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Luis_Suarez_suspended-305">&#91;302&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-306" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-306">&#91;303&#93;</a></sup> He was also banned from taking part in any football-related activity (including entering any stadium) for four months and fined <a href="/wiki/Swiss_franc" title="Swiss franc">CHF</a>100,000.<sup id="cite_ref-FIFABan_159-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FIFABan-159">&#91;156&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Ban2014_160-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Ban2014-160">&#91;157&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Luis_Suarez_suspended_305-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Luis_Suarez_suspended-305">&#91;302&#93;</a></sup> The seven-member FIFA panel studied the incident from 34 camera angles and rejected Suárez's defence that the bite was as a result of an accidental collision, instead finding the bite was "deliberate, intentional and without provocation... with the intention of wounding [Chiellini] or at least of destabilising him". The severity of the penalty was due to the fact it was Suárez's third biting offence, as well as what FIFA saw as a lack of remorse.<sup id="cite_ref-lostbalance_298-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-lostbalance-298">&#91;295&#93;</a></sup> Soon after the suspension was announced, online gambling firm <a href="/wiki/888poker" title="888poker">888poker</a> cancelled its sponsorship deal with Suárez.<sup id="cite_ref-307" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-307">&#91;304&#93;</a></sup> With Suárez banned, Uruguay lost their next match 02 to Colombia and were eliminated from the World Cup.<sup id="cite_ref-308" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-308">&#91;305&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On the same day the ban was announced, the <a href="/wiki/Uruguayan_Football_Association" title="Uruguayan Football Association">Uruguayan Football Association</a> (AUF) said it would appeal the suspension.<sup id="cite_ref-Uruguay_to_appeal_Suarez_ban_for_biting_309-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Uruguay_to_appeal_Suarez_ban_for_biting-309">&#91;306&#93;</a></sup> Suárez's lawyer said that "we don't have any doubts" of a European-based campaign against Suárez.<sup id="cite_ref-310" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-310">&#91;307&#93;</a></sup> Various Uruguayan individuals defended Suárez, questioning if he had actually bitten Chiellini, and criticised the severity of his ban, including <a href="/wiki/President_of_Uruguay" title="President of Uruguay">President of Uruguay</a> <a href="/wiki/Jos%C3%A9_Mujica" title="José Mujica">José Mujica</a>, who labelled the ban "<a href="/wiki/Fascism" title="Fascism">fascist</a>" and called FIFA "a bunch of old sons of bitches";<sup id="cite_ref-311" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-311">&#91;308&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-312" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-312">&#91;309&#93;</a></sup> AUF president Wilmar Valdez;<sup id="cite_ref-Uruguay_to_appeal_Suarez_ban_for_biting_309-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Uruguay_to_appeal_Suarez_ban_for_biting-309">&#91;306&#93;</a></sup> Uruguay captain <a href="/wiki/Diego_Lugano" title="Diego Lugano">Diego Lugano</a>;<sup id="cite_ref-313" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-313">&#91;310&#93;</a></sup> and Uruguay head coach Óscar Tabárez, who resigned from two FIFA posts in protest of the ban.<sup id="cite_ref-reactions_314-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-reactions-314">&#91;311&#93;</a></sup> The Uruguayan media were also noted to have been in a defiant and defensive mood.<sup id="cite_ref-315" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-315">&#91;312&#93;</a></sup> For non-Uruguayan parties, Chiellini, who was bitten, called the ban "excessive", while international players' union <a href="/wiki/FIFPro" title="FIFPro">FIFPro</a> called for Suárez to "receive all the support he needs" and that the "focus should be on the rehabilitation and serious treatment" of Suárez.<sup id="cite_ref-reactions_314-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-reactions-314">&#91;311&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Six days after the incident, on 30 June, Suárez apologised to Chiellini through Twitter and vowed never to repeat the incident, while writing that the "physical result of a bite" occurred in a collision with Chiellini.<sup id="cite_ref-Suarez_apology_Twitter_299-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Suarez_apology_Twitter-299">&#91;296&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Suarez_apology_The_Guardian_316-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Suarez_apology_The_Guardian-316">&#91;313&#93;</a></sup> Chiellini responded through Twitter indicating all was forgotten and his hope that FIFA would reduce Suárez's suspension.<sup id="cite_ref-Suarez_apology_The_Guardian_316-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Suarez_apology_The_Guardian-316">&#91;313&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Chiellini_response_Twitter_317-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Chiellini_response_Twitter-317">&#91;314&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 3 July, the AUF appealed Suárez's ban,<sup id="cite_ref-AUF_appeal_318-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AUF_appeal-318">&#91;315&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Suarez_suspended_while_appeal_is_pending_319-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Suarez_suspended_while_appeal_is_pending-319">&#91;316&#93;</a></sup> but it was rejected by FIFA on 10 July.<sup id="cite_ref-Suarez_appeal_rejected_FIFA_320-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Suarez_appeal_rejected_FIFA-320">&#91;317&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Suarez_appeal_rejected_BBC_321-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Suarez_appeal_rejected_BBC-321">&#91;318&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Suarez_appeal_rejected_Sky_Sports_322-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Suarez_appeal_rejected_Sky_Sports-322">&#91;319&#93;</a></sup> With Suárez's ban not preventing him from <a href="/wiki/Transfer_(association_football)" title="Transfer (association football)">transferring</a> to another club,<sup id="cite_ref-Suarez_no_transfer_ban_323-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Suarez_no_transfer_ban-323">&#91;320&#93;</a></sup> it was announced on 11 July that Suárez had agreed to move to Barcelona.<sup id="cite_ref-BBCpootobar_324-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BBCpootobar-324">&#91;321&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Suarez_Barcelona_transfer_official_325-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Suarez_Barcelona_transfer_official-325">&#91;322&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Suarez_Barcelona_transfer_Liverpool_326-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Suarez_Barcelona_transfer_Liverpool-326">&#91;323&#93;</a></sup> Days before the transfer, Suárez's apology to Chiellini had been praised by various Barcelona club individuals. Barcelona club president <a href="/wiki/Josep_Maria_Bartomeu" title="Josep Maria Bartomeu">Josep Maria Bartomeu</a> said the apology was "honourable", sporting director <a href="/wiki/Andoni_Zubizarreta" title="Andoni Zubizarreta">Andoni Zubizarreta</a> welcomed Suárez as being "humble enough to admit an error" while new signing <a href="/wiki/Ivan_Rakiti%C4%87" title="Ivan Rakiti">Ivan Rakiti</a> commended Suárez's "character and strength".<sup id="cite_ref-327" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-327">&#91;324&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-328" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-328">&#91;325&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span id="Copa_Am.C3.A9rica_Centenario_and_2018_FIFA_World_Cup"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="Copa_América_Centenario_and_2018_FIFA_World_Cup">Copa América Centenario and 2018 FIFA World Cup</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Luis_Su%C3%A1rez&amp;action=edit&amp;section=30" title="Edit section: Copa América Centenario and 2018 FIFA World Cup">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Luis_Su%C3%A1rez_Uruguay.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/62/Luis_Su%C3%A1rez_Uruguay.jpg/170px-Luis_Su%C3%A1rez_Uruguay.jpg" decoding="async" width="170" height="269" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/62/Luis_Su%C3%A1rez_Uruguay.jpg/255px-Luis_Su%C3%A1rez_Uruguay.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/62/Luis_Su%C3%A1rez_Uruguay.jpg/340px-Luis_Su%C3%A1rez_Uruguay.jpg 2x" data-file-width="732" data-file-height="1160" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Luis_Su%C3%A1rez_Uruguay.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Suárez playing against <a href="/wiki/Portugal_national_football_team" title="Portugal national football team">Portugal</a> in the last 16 of the 2018 World Cup</div></div></div>
<p>On 25 March 2016, after over a year of international absence for Uruguay, Suárez scored an equalizer against Brazil in <a href="/wiki/Recife" title="Recife">Recife</a> for a 22 draw in the <a href="/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_(CONMEBOL)" title="2018 FIFA World Cup qualification (CONMEBOL)">qualification process</a> for the <a href="/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2018 FIFA World Cup">2018 FIFA World Cup</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-329" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-329">&#91;326&#93;</a></sup> Suárez was included in Uruguay's 23-man squad for the <a href="/wiki/Copa_Am%C3%A9rica_Centenario" title="Copa América Centenario">Copa América Centenario</a>, although a hamstring injury sustained in the 2016 Copa del Rey final on 22 May put his place in the team in jeopardy.<sup id="cite_ref-Suárez_set_to_miss_start_of_Copa_América_195-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Suárez_set_to_miss_start_of_Copa_América-195">&#91;192&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-hamstring_injury_194-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-hamstring_injury-194">&#91;191&#93;</a></sup> Although he remained in the squad, he missed both of his national side's opening group losses to Mexico and <a href="/wiki/Venezuela_national_football_team" title="Venezuela national football team">Venezuela</a>, which resulted in a first-round elimination from the tournament.<sup id="cite_ref-330" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-330">&#91;327&#93;</a></sup> He was once again left on the substitutes' bench in Uruguay's final 30 group win over <a href="/wiki/Jamaica_national_football_team" title="Jamaica national football team">Jamaica</a> on 13 June.<sup id="cite_ref-331" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-331">&#91;328&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Suárez scored twice on 10 October 2017 as Uruguay won 42 at home to <a href="/wiki/Bolivia_national_football_team" title="Bolivia national football team">Bolivia</a> in their final World Cup qualifying match, thus securing their place for the tournament in Russia, as well as becoming the joint all-time leading scorer in CONMEBOL World Cup qualifiers with 21 goals, alongside Argentina's Lionel Messi, overtaking the previous record which was held by <a href="/wiki/Hern%C3%A1n_Crespo" title="Hernán Crespo">Hernán Crespo</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-332" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-332">&#91;329&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-333" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-333">&#91;330&#93;</a></sup> In March, Uruguay won the <a href="/wiki/2018_China_Cup" title="2018 China Cup">2018 China Cup</a>, and Suárez scored his <a href="/wiki/List_of_association_football_players_with_50_or_more_international_goals" class="mw-redirect" title="List of association football players with 50 or more international goals">50th international goal</a> with a penalty against the <a href="/wiki/Czech_Republic_national_football_team" title="Czech Republic national football team">Czech Republic</a> in the semi-finals, winning it himself when fouled by goalkeeper <a href="/wiki/Ji%C5%99%C3%AD_Pavlenka" title="Jií Pavlenka">Jií Pavlenka</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-334" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-334">&#91;331&#93;</a></sup> He won his <a href="/wiki/List_of_men%27s_footballers_with_100_or_more_international_caps" title="List of men&#39;s footballers with 100 or more international caps">100th cap</a> on 20 June 2018 in Uruguay's second group match at the World Cup, scoring the only goal against <a href="/wiki/Saudi_Arabia_national_football_team" title="Saudi Arabia national football team">Saudi Arabia</a> at the <a href="/wiki/Rostov_Arena" title="Rostov Arena">Rostov Arena</a> in <a href="/wiki/Rostov-on-Don" title="Rostov-on-Don">Rostov-on-Don</a> to advance the nation into the last 16.<sup id="cite_ref-335" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-335">&#91;332&#93;</a></sup> In the final group game on 25 June, Suárez scored Uruguay's opener with a free kick into the bottom corner in a 30 win over hosts <a href="/wiki/Russia_national_football_team" title="Russia national football team">Russia</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-336" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-336">&#91;333&#93;</a></sup> In the Round of 16 match against <a href="/wiki/Portugal_national_football_team" title="Portugal national football team">Portugal</a> on 30 June, he set-up Cavani's opening goal in an eventual 21 victory.<sup id="cite_ref-337" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-337">&#91;334&#93;</a></sup> Uruguay were eliminated from the tournament following a 20 defeat to France in the quarter-finals on 6 July.<sup id="cite_ref-338" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-338">&#91;335&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span id="2019.E2.80.93present:_Copa_Am.C3.A9rica_upset"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="2019present:_Copa_América_upset">2019present: Copa América upset</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Luis_Su%C3%A1rez&amp;action=edit&amp;section=31" title="Edit section: 2019present: Copa América upset">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<p>In March 2019, manager Tabárez included Suárez in the final 23-man Uruguay squad for the <a href="/wiki/2019_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica" title="2019 Copa América">2019 Copa América</a> in Brazil.<sup id="cite_ref-339" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-339">&#91;336&#93;</a></sup> On 16 June, he scored the third goal in a 40 win over <a href="/wiki/Ecuador_national_football_team" title="Ecuador national football team">Ecuador</a> in the team's opening group match of the tournament, also setting up the opener scored by <a href="/wiki/Nicol%C3%A1s_Lodeiro" title="Nicolás Lodeiro">Nicolás Lodeiro</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-340" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-340">&#91;337&#93;</a></sup>
In the quarter-finals against Peru on 29 June, he had a goal disallowed by VAR for offside, and was subsequently the only player to miss his spot-kick in the resulting penalty shoot-out, following a 00 draw after regulation time, which saw Uruguay eliminated from the competition.<sup id="cite_ref-341" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-341">&#91;338&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 8 October 2020, Suárez scored the first goal of the South American <a href="/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_(CONMEBOL)" title="2022 FIFA World Cup qualification (CONMEBOL)">2022 FIFA World Cup qualification</a>, becoming the first player ever to score the opening goal three times (after his 2010 and 2014 strikes) in the competition's history.<sup id="cite_ref-342" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-342">&#91;339&#93;</a></sup> Later on 14 October, he scored a brace in a 42 defeat to Ecuador, overtaking Brazil's <a href="/wiki/Ronaldo_(Brazilian_footballer)" title="Ronaldo (Brazilian footballer)">Ronaldo</a> to set the record for most goals scored by a South American footballer in competitive international matches.<sup id="cite_ref-343" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-343">&#91;340&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Style_of_play">Style of play</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Luis_Su%C3%A1rez&amp;action=edit&amp;section=32" title="Edit section: Style of play">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Luis_Suarez_runs_at_Distin_3.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0f/Luis_Suarez_runs_at_Distin_3.jpg/220px-Luis_Suarez_runs_at_Distin_3.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="208" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0f/Luis_Suarez_runs_at_Distin_3.jpg/330px-Luis_Suarez_runs_at_Distin_3.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0f/Luis_Suarez_runs_at_Distin_3.jpg/440px-Luis_Suarez_runs_at_Distin_3.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1001" data-file-height="948" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Luis_Suarez_runs_at_Distin_3.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Suárez in action for Liverpool takes on <a href="/wiki/Sylvain_Distin" title="Sylvain Distin">Sylvain Distin</a> of <a href="/wiki/Everton_F.C." title="Everton F.C.">Everton</a> during the <a href="/wiki/Merseyside_Derby" class="mw-redirect" title="Merseyside Derby">Merseyside Derby</a> in 2012</div></div></div>
<p>Suárez creates goal scoring chances with his powerful shot,<sup id="cite_ref-9_Suarez_profile_248-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-9_Suarez_profile-248">&#91;245&#93;</a></sup> and has "remarkable technical ability" according to his <a href="/wiki/FIFA" title="FIFA">FIFA</a> profile.<sup id="cite_ref-9_Suarez_profile_248-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-9_Suarez_profile-248">&#91;245&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-soccernet_stats_344-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-soccernet_stats-344">&#91;341&#93;</a></sup> Known for his direct running at players, Suárez has a particular penchant for <a href="/wiki/Nutmeg_(football)" class="mw-redirect" title="Nutmeg (football)">nutmegging</a> opponents (putting the ball through their legs).<sup id="cite_ref-345" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-345">&#91;342&#93;</a></sup> Liverpool fans (accompanied with a banner) used to say he was so good, "he could nutmeg a mermaid".<sup id="cite_ref-346" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-346">&#91;343&#93;</a></sup> Often regarded by many as one of the best strikers of all time,<sup id="cite_ref-354" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-354">&#91;note 4&#93;</a></sup> Suarez is a prolific goalscorer, having the unique distinction of being the leading scorer in three top-flight European leagues, a feat only matched by <a href="/wiki/Ruud_van_Nistelrooy" title="Ruud van Nistelrooy">Ruud van Nistelrooy</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-355" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-355">&#91;351&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Harry_Redknapp" title="Harry Redknapp">Harry Redknapp</a> said that Suárez could play anywhere  as the <a href="/wiki/Centre_forward" class="mw-redirect" title="Centre forward">target man</a> or behind as a <a href="/wiki/Forward_(association_football)#Second_striker" title="Forward (association football)">second striker</a>.
